products.title: Ricoh 910725 Theta V camera, Metallic Gray

productreview.author: Chris P. Bacon
productreview.reviewTitle: Huge improvements over the previous Theta, but the V still has some huge limitations that affect its performance
productreview.review: I almost bought Ricoh's previous version of the Theta about a year ago, but where I felt it fell short was the picture quality. Fast-forward to the release of this new 4K version and I knew it was something I needed to at least try. As a preface to my review, I'm a professional photographer and videographer and I also instruct both subjects, so there were lots of ideas and potential uses I had for this device. First, let me start off by highlighting the GOOD things about the Theta V, because unfortunately in my opinion there are far fewer positive things than negative when it comes to this little doodad: - The physical design and footprint of the device is good - it's relatively small and unobtrusive which makes it totally viable for recording a small or private event without being in the way. It does have LEDs when it's on and recording, but in my opinion they are not distracting which is also a good thing. - It's easy to use - when the app connects properly, it's quite simple and straightforward to use. I say when because in my experience with the Theta I've had a lot of connectivity issues in terms of my phone dropping the connection to the camera, even when I'm standing right next to it...but I'll talk more about that when I get to the cons below. - The software is also easy to use - when it comes to importing and converting your files to be compatible in a 360 space, it's as simple and dragging and dropping the original file into the window, selecting where you want the converted file to be saved, and that's pretty much it. There are a couple of other options available as well: one lets you downsample the quality from 4K to HD, and the other lets you choose whether you want the stitching software to "fix" the top and bottom of the file...all in all, it's quite easy to use which I was really happy about since sometimes the software you need to operate special camera equipment can be more difficult to figure out than the equipment itself. - The standard tripod mount on the bottom of the Theta makes it compatible with just about any tripod and makes it mountable just about anywhere, and it can also be used handheld, so it's very versatile in that regard. - The battery life seems fairly on-par with the limited internal memory - I'm listing this as a pro because the battery did last long enough for me to record the footage I needed, but if your plan is to use it professionally you may find that both the internal storage and battery life are limiting. - The flat bottom - I'm really glad they made the bottom flat so that you can just stand it up on a flat surface. There might only be specific situations where you could or would want to use it like that, but I'm glad it's at least possible. - One thing I like about the app is that you can view the camera feed output in stitched or unstitched view which is sometimes helpful to be able to switch back and forth so easily. Okay, now onto the BAD things about the Theta V...here we go: - One of the biggest and most frustrating issues with the Theta V, as I see it, is that you lose access to live view through the app while you are recording. So when the camera is setup but not recording, you can see what the camera sees inside the app (in stitched or unstitched view). But as soon as you start recording, live view is no longer available inside the app until you stop recording. I understand that they maybe couldn't have programmed it to have live view while filming, but all I'm saying is that it is a major downside to not be able to see what you're capturing as you're capturing it. This was a huge strike against the Theta V for me. - Due to the file format and how the 360 video files need to be converted before they can work properly in a 360 space, I could not seem to play any of my recordings back through the app. I know you can configure the camera to work as a remote to watch live playback on a television, but frankly this feature is pretty useless in a lot of (most) situations since how often are you going to have access to a TV for playback? Maybe there is a way to watch your recordings in the app, but I couldn't not figure out how. Again, it's a small inconvenience but when you stack it on top of all the other small inconveniences, well...you'll see what my verdict is. - No expandable storage OR exchangeable batteries - if the first two cons I listed weren't dealbreakers for you, this one very well could be. You are limited not only by the internal storage of 19GB (which is not much, especially when it comes to 4K video) but you're also limited to its built-in battery. No, you cannot expand the memory with a MicroSD card once the internal memory is full. No, you cannot purchase extra batteries to be able to continue using the camera after the internal battery dies. In my opinion, these types of limitations are pretty inexcusable in 2017. Even if these were the only two things that they "fix" for the next version of the Theta, it would be an immensely more useful device. - Another con is that there are visible stitch lines in certain weather and/or certain lighting situations. Obviously the stitching can't be perfect, so if you're expecting it to be, you're likely going to be disappointed. The way they stitch the videos together is quite good in my opinion and certainly usable, but again, just don't expect it to look perfect. - In my experience, even the picture quality on this 4K Theta seems a little poor. Based on my comparisons with footage shot with the previous version of the Theta the quality is certainly much better, but when you compare it to footage shot with an actual 4K camera it definitely doesn't measure up. Which is to be expected because the thing only costs $500...I would expect a $1,000+ DSLR to produce better quality so this isn't really a surprise, but it was a little disappointing nonetheless that the quality wasn't still a little better than it is. - I do like that Ricoh included a soft pouch for carrying the Theta V, but for the price it would have been nice if they could have also included a simple hardshell case with a soft inner material to protect the lenses. - I've already mentioned the fact that you can't buy extra batteries, but another thing worth mentioning is the battery life. I know I listed it as a pro because for me personally the battery lasted long enough, but like I said above, if you plan on using it professionally I expect that you will feel very limited by the life of the internal battery. - Poor connectivity - in my experience with the Theta V, the wifi range is extremely poor especially outdoors. My phone would drop the connection to the camera if I was moving around, and even when I was standing just a few feet away from the Theta it would still disconnect and none of the app features would work until I reconnected the wifi connection. Again, this is just another inconvenience that, when paired with the rest of them, makes for a frustrating user experience a lot of the time. If the wifi connection wasn't such garbage and you could start/stop recording from a number of feet away (like you should be able to) then it would be so much better. - As easy as the software is to use, it's still kind of a pain that you need special software to convert or play these videos. I understand that is just the nature of the beast of 360 videos, but it's still a con as far as I'm concerned. - Price. Obviously I have no idea what it costs to design or manufacture a device like this, but based on my use and experience with it, I would say that a price tag of around $300-400 would seem much more reasonable, especially given its limitations. In my opinion $500+ is a lot of money to spend on this item which is certainly neat but has some serious and restrictive shortcomings. - In my experience it is ideal to use mounted on a stationary tripod. Not only is the 360 video a bit hard to watch if the camera is also in motion, but the stitching from the software that removes the Theta from the frame becomes really noticeable and weird-looking when the pixels around it are moving. - Very poor dynamic range, especially in low light - I wouldn't expect the low-light performance of any $500 camera to be great, but even with that being said it is quite awful. The dynamic range is much better when there's lots of available light, but if you're shooting in an area that's even slightly dim you will lose almost all of the detail in any dark or shadowy part of the frame. - I would have liked the ability to rotate a recording within the app whether before or after filming. For example, so you could hold the Theta upside down in order to get an extremely low angle. Perhaps this is a feature and I just didn't see it, but I don't think it's possible and I think that a rotation option would make it a lot more versatile. - The total remaining recording time left on your internal memory is hidden in the live view settings - I'm listing this is a con because I think this information should absolutely be displayed on the main app/live view screen, not buried in a menu somewhere. When you're limited to 19GB of internal memory, it becomes extremely important to manage your space and I think that would be much easier if the remaining memory was always visible within the app, just like the battery meter. All in all, the Theta V is a really neat and interesting piece of equipment that does a relatively good job of recording 360 video and audio in a fairly simple way. However, it has some pretty significant limitations that make it impossible for me to be able to justify keeping it. I think that if Ricoh addresses some of these problems for the next version of the Theta, it could be a truly wonderful device that would absolutely have a spot in my camera bag. But for now it feels like something that is almost there but just not quite enough to be worth having at this point in time.

productreview.author: Kris Tarr
productreview.reviewTitle: Good dynamic range and companion apps, but disappointing build-quality
productreview.review: As my 360 virtual tour business started taking off, I "upgraded" to this camera and though I really wanted to like it, I was very disappointed in the build-quality. The first unit I ordered had one of its lenses misaligned, making half the 360 image blurry, so I had to return it. But once I received the replacement unit and used it on the very first project, I found that it had the same exact problem as the first one. The attached photo, taken in good lighting conditions, illustrates the misalignment of one lens making the whole right-side of the spherical image blurry and as you can see the resolution is not that great either. The only reason I did not give a one-star rating is because of the good dynamic range and decent companion apps.

productreview.author: VN
productreview.review: I didn't expect the greatest but for $560 CAD, I expected more quality than what I'm getting. My 360 tours looked like I used a 2009 phone with 25 megapixels. The noise and chromatic abberation is pretty bad. However I need it for my job and the only affordable option for the platform I'm using. This is at most a $300-$400 camera.

productreview.author: JP King
productreview.reviewTitle: Not durable enough to absorb a 2 feet fall.
productreview.review: Used this extensively in our European tour. It took very good 360 photos and videos. It fell flat on a cobbled stone road while on a slim tripod, the 2 lenses survived the impact but not the unit. It starts up for a few seconds then a beep and red light goes off then powers off. I am now sending to Ricoh service for a fix under warranty. Not a durable product and I am disappointed.

productreview.author: Sanda Iordachescu
productreview.reviewTitle: Excellent, easy to use, but image quality - not the best
productreview.review: Excellent for non-professional 3D photographers; Image is not as good as I expected.  Ricoh Theta Z1 is probably better to obtain higher image quality. However, it is Overpriced and it can be damaged easily (no protection anti-shock by design, so be extra-cateful!). Here it is my story: After using my new V camera less than 3 weeks, a powerful wind took it down with the tripod; I was lucky as the lens were not damaged. AND, again lucky to avoid a huge repair price provided by the service, and made it work again by myself (I have optoelectrinics background). So far, all works great, the only thing that bothers me is the image quality (obviously depends on the lens) I reccommend the device - it is a wonderful technological work in progress - well done and delightful!

productreview.author: Munchkin the Reviewer
productreview.review: This was a very good 360 camera. 👍 Clear images with great color tone 👍 Small size and easy to use 👍 Easily works with Google Street View app 👍 Easy to use app 👍 Great video resolution 🧐 I really liked this camera. Although I don’t use it as much as my Fusion for professional stuff, this camera is small and easier to carry around for family stuff

productreview.author: Marie-Annick Cloutier
productreview.review: J'ai acheter cette appareil pour mes voyages, puisque j'étais tannée de chercher des angles parfait ou des parametres parfaits pour prendre des photos. Je l'adore! Il capte le moment présent, la qualité est géniale et toutes mes photos sont toujours très apprécié par mon entourage!

productreview.author: Stephanie
productreview.review: The product was cracked open leaving a gap! I was able to snap it back together without any issues and looks good as new however, we had to return it because we weren't too sure about the quality especially when we witnessed it being broken the moment we received it. Its not the cheapest camera, sadly not the quality we were expecting.

productreview.author: Dominique
productreview.review: Je suis courtier immobilier je peu maintenant faire mes propres visites 360 La qualité d’image est très bien et ont peu toujours les améliorer aussi avec un logiciel. Garder en tête par contre que vous devez avoir un abonnement d’environ 450$/année pour avoir accès au lien 360 de vos montages. Avec le logiciel tours de Ricoh. Mais c est la même chose avec peu importe la caméra. Très facile de faire le Montage 360 directement avec votre téléphone. Bien satisfaite

productreview.author: Lil_Chickita
productreview.review: I bought this for my husband. He loved it. Found it easy to use, and like the picture quality he was getting. Also seemed to have decent battery life. Another great feature is the option to purchase an underwater housing for it too. Being avid scuba divers, we look forward to trying it underwater on our next dive trip!

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.reviewTitle: Connaître les glitchs permet d'obtenir les meilleures photos
productreview.review: Allez vous informer en ligne sur comment activer le balancement des blancs et des tonalités, car c'est avec ça que vous pourrez prendre les meilleures photos qui ne sont pas pixelisées. Les gens ici qui disent que l'image est pixelisée se sont simplement butées aux glitchs dans les paramètres de l'application. Une fois que j'ai su comment activier le hdr, configurer le balancement des blancs, iso etc c'est là que j'ai pris mes meilleures photos.

productreview.author: Talha Tabish
productreview.review: image quality is amazing. i’ve been using this for different purposes. i’m getting into 3d rendering and use the camera to create quick HDRIs which come out quite clean. I also have been dabbling in 360 streaming, which has been quite useful during this quarantine, allowing our friends and family who aren’t able to make it to some special events due to capacity restrictions to enjoy the day and observe the entire room.

productreview.author: VancouverSean
productreview.review: Unfortunately the product housing exploded after being tipped over on the tripoid. It didn't hit hard, but the bump was enough to explode the components.. Now it won't go back together properly. Very cheaply made for what it costs.

productreview.author: Jed
productreview.review: I owned this for 4 hours which was 3 hours and 59 minutes too long. I was going to ya edit for work but it’s slow, cumbersome and really unnecessary. My phone does good enough. Maybe it’s my fault, maybe my expectations were to high.

productreview.author: Cristian Sanchez
productreview.review: Good camera, great videos and pictures, battery inside and no external card. Internal memory bad for that but good quality

productreview.author: Leonard Mabee
productreview.review: lot of money for the value it works but it is a hell of a job to get it figured out cool camera  lots of issue's but once ya figure it out ..its pretty cool

productreview.author: Joeadamxx
productreview.review: Beautiful pictures and video coming from a novice. Unfortunately, it zaps battery when taking video

productreview.author: Joel Wiebe
productreview.review: Good resolution, easy to comnect. We used it for Google My Business listings and it worked great.

productreview.author: Hammond
productreview.review: There are cheaper alternatives that do the job as well. Unless you're using it with a certain app where they only support Ricoh Theta check the Xiaomi alternatives

productreview.author: Rob Gurdebeke
productreview.review: This is my second Ricoh 360 camera. The V replaces an earlier model, the SC. The V is much better. Faster transfer speed and image quality. But a quality low profile tripod while you're at it.

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.review: The item arrived on time and is as described it took a little while to get used to connecting

productreview.author: Su
productreview.review: Nice camera but not that high resolution

productreview.author: Joey
productreview.review: The quality of the photos is way better than expected. Takes full HD photo spheres and you can't tell where the seam is at all. Perfect for Real Estate photography.

productreview.author: Mark
productreview.review: I do wish it took higher resolution photos but it is as described and the camera works well.

productreview.author: Eric H
productreview.review: This is a very cool device and takes great pictures easily.  It is simple to get them into a VR rig or onto Facebook as well.

productreview.author: CCDMA
productreview.review: Love the quality and how easy it is to use!

productreview.author: Elitsa
productreview.review: very good

productreview.author: Carl Servant
productreview.review: I've receive the package in time. Ricoh Theta V works very well with my Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge. I find the photos a little blurry but I need to test it more.

productreview.author: Alison
productreview.review: Great shipping time. Great camera!

productreview.author: martin laberge
productreview.review: Attention Caméra pour personne ayant un ordinateur assez récent sinon vous devez vous munir de complications au niveau des plugins

productreview.author: SeanIsraelson
productreview.review: Best 360 cameras

productreview.author: Bruce G.
productreview.review: Great little unit. Resolution is a bit disappointing when zooming in on pics, but very useful on job sites.

productreview.author: Isaac Adams-Hands
productreview.review: Outdoor image quality is poor. Wish I got a better model.

productreview.author: Christopher Gaska
productreview.reviewTitle: Must be paired with an Apple iPhone or iPad to be functional. Android would be nice.
productreview.review: For the price it's a solid buy.

productreview.author: Steeve
productreview.reviewTitle: Nice 20MP resolution, perfect stitching . All I was asking.
productreview.review: I just love it!

productreview.author: mark caswell-daniels
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 30, 2017
productreview.review: Have been a big fan of Ricoh Theta cameras for some time and have a good experience with 360 media and equipment. Here are the Pro's of the V in my experience, compared with the S and other cams: - 4k video is really good quality and copes with low lighting well (far far better than the Nikon KeyMission). - 4k video can be streamed to youtube via a PC (a driver, currently in beta, is needed to do this but it does it well). - the transfer speeds over wifi are very fast (a big step up over the Theta S) - The app is still really great. - It can be charged with any charger (Theta S would refuse to charge with a high amp usb charger) - Ability to run apps on it seems promising (edit: This is being rolled out soon 2018) - Ability to sense tilt seems promising (edit: now auto stabilises video) - Small deadzone. the lenses are close together, there's very little dead space in the image. - images every 4 seconds with timelapse mode rather than 7 - can stream to a tv that has an amazon firestick. The Cons: - Same image sensor as the Theta S. The camera has a faster processor and you should get less noise on the images, but the resolution is the same. - Image stitching seems worse.. maybe due to the new lens system.. Imagine a firmware update will fix this. (edit: some way to being fixed) - Still no SD Card slot. Don't feel like opening this one up just yet, but all the others have had SD cards hidden inside them.. these have probably been kept hidden as they'd need a fast SD card to work well with 4k video.. perhaps people would complain their card didn't work all the time if they put an access slot in? insta, samsung, mija all have this. - Still has a plastic tripod thread, this was a bit fragile and actually broke on my S. - There's no autostabilistion like on Mija or insta360 cameras, despite it having sensors to do so.. this should at least be able to be applied in post production on the app. (Edit: the autostabilisation now works) - Bit pricey really.

productreview.author: Pete E
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 28, 2018
productreview.review: Things you need to understand about this camera. 1. It takes 360° Spherical images. 2. It does not spin around 3. You need to use two apps. The Ricoh Theta App and the Ricoh Theta+ app. 4. You need to learn how to remove the Nadir. Check YouTube for tutorials on this.  The nadir is the image that remains of the tripod mount you use when you take a picture. 5. You need to learn about Tiny Planets.  These are app made filtered images that are pretty cool.  Again check Instagram this time for examples. 6. Learn how to take images using the self timer function. 7. You will also need a monopod with a tripod base suitable for this camera. The Ricoh one is overpriced.  I bought a carbon fibre one and a separate base. You don’t need one straight away - but as you develop your 360° photo taking skills it will be a requirement. Essentially this is the latest model of the Theta family.  (UPDATE MAY2019 THE Z1 IS NOW THE LATEST MODEL) It has a faster processor and offers 4K 360° video as well as spherical sound (with added microphone) (UPDATE- I USED THE EXTERNAL MICROPHONE AND IT ADDED NOTHING IMHO - OTHER THAN A WIND NOISE SUPPRESSING FOAM, THERE WAS NO BENEFICIAL INCREASE IN SOUND CLARITY) The theta has the best examples of stitched in camera stitching of all the cameras out there.  For the money you can’t really get  better.  So there’s one reason to get it. The camera uses its in house Wi-fi to connect to your smart phone and you take the photo using the theta app. You can extend the connection by connecting the camera to your home or any router - a feature only V can do. I would also advise getting a silicon skin straight away. Cheap enough to buy. (UPDATE - A SILICON SKIN CREATES A SHADOW IN THE IMAGE, SO BUY A CASE INSTEAD) There is a more technical side to manipulating and displaying 360° photos so you do need to do your research otherwise you will be disappointed. However if you’re set on joint the 360° revolution (pun intended) this is the best camera you can get for the money. Both the little sister and brothers of this camera the S and the SC are equally good at taking still photos - you just lack the 4K and a few other features.  So if you don’t want to spend £300+ I would advise getting one of those.  They’re a bit slower due to the processor but they are pretty brilliant too.

productreview.author: Chris Fletcher
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 17, 2018
productreview.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Prior to a trip to Hawaii and Las Vegas I wanted to get a good camera, something different, to capture the vacation. I thought about a drone, but went for this instead, and I am SO Please that I did. Some of the results are fantastic. I've put a couple "little planet" Conversions up. I love how these come out.

productreview.author: colrol
productreview.review: Je dois vous prévenir d'une chose, cette caméra m'a été offerte, je suis donc sans doute plus enclin à la trouver géniale que si j'avais dû investir mon argent... Les points positifs : - je la trouve très compacte, on la glisse dans la poche et on la dégaine rapidement. Idéale pour les ballades - rapide, on clique et la photo se prend tout de suite (pas de temps d'attente de mise au point ou autre...) - j'adore le visionnage où l'on navigue dans la photo en orientant son smartphone - finalement je l'utilise à titre professionnel, sur chantier, plus besoin de prendre des dizaines de photos et panoramiques pour se rendre compte qu'il en manque toujours un coin, en 1 clic, TOUT est là. - possibilité de la piloter entièrement à distance par smartphone pour avoir des photos complètement vierges les points négatifs : - quelques problèmes d'allumage aux premières utilisations, impossible de comprendre si il s'agissait d'un problème de batterie ... - peut être la définition un peu juste, on voudrait pouvoir zoomer encore davantage sur les images Si mon commentaire vous a aidé, n'hésitez pas à mentionner qu'il vous a été utile. Cela me fait toujours plaisir de savoir que je suis lu et que mon commentaire a pu aider quelqu'un! :)

productreview.author: Jonathan P.
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 5, 2017
productreview.review: DOES NOT RECORD 360 SPACIAL AUDIO WITHOUT THE ADDITIONAL MICROPHONE! Even though Amazon's description says it can, or rather, doesn't actually state implicitly that you need the microphone to achieve 360 spacial audio recording. If you don't want the 360 spacial audio then it's a great camera by itself. Converting software is required to get it into an equirectangular format and download times from the camera to a laptop is quite slow, to a phone (I have an iPhone 7) is reeeeeeeeeally slow! As long as you have patience and planning, the footage is great.

productreview.author: Dr. Paul Ell
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 24, 2019
productreview.review: This is an impressive, small, 4K 360 camera. It is very easy to use after a little bit of preparation linking the unit to your mobile phone. This involves downloading the Ricoh app available for iOS or Android, in my case installing a firmware update, and linking the phone and the camera via bluetooth. The camera takes 360 still frames, 360 video and will stream 360 video live. Without the optional, but very expensive, attachable microphone, it still captures sound at a fair quality level using in built microphones. There is a software update which links the camera directly to an Oculus Go headset so that you can review images immediately after capture in a VR environment which is a big bonus. Less positively the battery life of the camera is quite limited, you cannot add additional storage to the camera as there's not memory card port, and it's very easy to get out of bluetooth range in use so you can't press the shutter button remotely from a distance - so there's a danger you end up appearing in all shots. Overall though an easy to use quality camera. Four stars.

productreview.author: gillipies
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 2, 2018
productreview.review: Bought the Theta V for use as an underwater camera, along with the Ricoh TW-1 underwater housing. It seemed to get the best reviews for the price. Very easy to use with minimal buttons for operation - handy when you have thick scuba gloves on! Slightly annoying there is no memory card slot - I've found that it will record ~45 minutes of footage in 4k before it is full. Battery life seems good however. Also fairly time consuming to get the footage into a usable state to upload to YouTube etc but it's worth it. Stitch lines are there in underwater footage but far less noticeable than I saw with other cameras, Ricoh TW-1 underwater housing also has a visible crescent of the housing at the bottom of the shot but no way around this. As above, the combination of camera and housing was the best I felt I could get for the money. The camera is not as compact as other GoPro style cameras but feels sturdy with good built quality. Certainly not disappointed and will continue to enjoy using it!

productreview.author: J Scrumpy
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2019
productreview.review: After returning from a recent trip I found that my favourite photos were the 360 degree ones. However the stitching on them was never perfect, it was almost impossible to take them in busy places and they take quite a while to take with a Pixel XL. After reading a number of reviews and looking at the Pros and Cons of cameras which were slightly cheaper/more expensive. This one works for me for low light/normal UK weather mainly just taking photos with this. The main negative for me is that the lenses can't be replaced, so if you drop this camera and it's not insured you will have to buy a new one for £££.  I found a silicone sleeve case on Amazon which covers the case and has a removable lens cover. I have had some intermittent issues connecting to the camera wirelessly from my phone.

productreview.author: Casse pied
productreview.review: ... ich habe mit der LG 360 CAM begonnen, bin dann zur RICOH Theta S gewechselt und nun bei der Theta V. Was die Software der Kamera  betrifft, ist noch sehr viel Luft nach oben. Die Verarbeitung ist hochwertig, die Optik gut, das Stitching bei Video und Photo wesentlich besser geworden, auch die Geschwindigkeit der Übertragung auf das Smartphone geht jetzt rasant. Die Klagen, welche hier geführt werden, sind verständlich aber durchaus nicht immer gerechtfertigt: z. B. mache ich fast immer Serienfotos mit der Intervallfunktion mit  ISO oder Belichtungs Vorwahl. Ich habe die Kamera auf einem sehr handlichen Selfie Stick in der Tasche und kann sie somit schnell bedienen. Nachbearbeitet werden Fotos und Videos auf meinem LG G5 mit diversen Apps von der Retouche bis hin zur Objektentfernung - nur bei Stativaufnahmen. Auch die nicht allein für die Theta V typischen chromatichen Aberrationen, welche gegenüber der Theta S weniger gravierend sind, werden nachbearbeitet. Erst dann erfolgt das Hochladen auf die ein oder andere Plattform. Insgesamt bin ich mit dieser Kamera sehr zufrieden. Softwareupdates und - Weiterentwicklung sind vom Hersteller in Aussicht gestellt. Klare Kaufempfehlung.

productreview.author: Oliver
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 25, 2018
productreview.review: Although the camera does what it says, and records at 4k, what I hadn't taken into account was that the 4k now has to spread over a 360 degree sphere.  This means that the final viewed quality is a lot less than HD.  Not the fault of teh camera, just a fact of life that there are not enough pixels to go around. Having said that - it is a super easy camera to use, stitching is in real time - no need for any post in that respect which is a huge bonus.  I used NCH VideoPad to edit together a couple of clips without any problem at all. Any people / objects more than about 2 meters away loose definition and as for someone at the other side of the room - forget about it.  This camera is for intimate settings like a small music session, or a group of people chatting. As for me, I'm now waiting for the 180 degree cameras due in 2019.  They have more raw pixels to shoot with and the final image only has to be spread across a hemispheres - by all accounts giving much sharper experience.

productreview.author: Michael Crowe
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 10, 2019
productreview.review: Easy to carry around in your pocket and works with the press of a button. Make sure that you get into the centre of what's happening because it's a 360 camera so you don't point it like a normal camera. Spatial audio is actually very good. Can film in very low light with great results.

productreview.author: E. Gopalakrishnan
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 3, 2018
productreview.review: Best feature: portability The design enables you to carry the device in your pocket. The bulging lenses really have to be protected. So although it would fit in your pocket, please use a nice case. This isn't built for action in waters. It is not water resistant. So be careful. Don't use it like you would use an action camera. Beautiful picture quality. Excellent dynamic range. The editor app on the phone does an excellent job. Videos are great quality too.

productreview.author: reinhold messner
productreview.review: Bildqualität ist auf mäßigem Smartphonemamera-Niveau (letztere kann natürlich keine 360 Grad Fotos). Naja, es sollen ja keine Kunstwerke sein, die Kamera ist für Schnappschüsse gedacht. Enttäuscht bin ich von der Bluetooth-Funktion, in die ich größere Erwartungen gesteckt hätte. V.a. in Kombination mit der iPhone App, hier gäbe es viel Optimierungspotential. Die eigentlich sehr elegante Funktion, via Bluetooth-Verbindung die GPS Position zu übertragen, auch wenn die App gerade nicht geöffnet ist (damit man auch mal mit der Kamera direkt ein Foto machen kann, ohne jedes Mal das Handy einzuschalten und die App starten zu müssen) kann man im Alltag getrost vergessen, denn die App verbraucht dann unverschämt viel Strom (nach wenigen Stunden ist der Akku ganz leer, also ungeeignet für einen Urlaubstag mit gelegentlichen Schnappschüssen). Die Geotagging-Funktion der App ist von den Entwicklern offensichtlich nie im realen Einsatz getestet worden. Das Intervall in dem die GPS Position abgefragt wird ist wohl viel zu kurz programmiert, ohne Einflussmöglichkeit dies zu verlängern um den Stromverbrauch auf ein Maß zu reduzieren, damit die Funktion nutzbar ist. (Möchte man den Stromverbrauch der App vorrübergehend reduzieren, geht dass nur über die Einstellung in der App selbst, diese ist aber nur verfügbar wenn die Kamera über WLAN verbunden ist, nicht bei Verbindung nur über Bluetooth. Sehr umständlich, und der Weg die stromfressende vermutlich jede Sekunde erfolgende GPS Lokalisierung über die iPhone Einstellung zu deaktivieren, um vorübergehend den Akkuverbrauch des Smartphones zu reduzieren - ohne nur dafür extra die Kamera aus der Tasche zu holen, einzuschalten, WLAN zu aktivieren, dann in der App ins Untermenü zu gehen... - ist wegen der unsauber bzw. schlecht programmierten App auch zwecklos: Die App zieht auch massig Strom wenn man ihr den Zugriff auf die GPS Position entzieht - sie versucht es wohl sekündlich weiter auch wenn sie gar keinen Zugriff auf die GPS Position hat und verheizt den Akku nutzlos weiter). Die zweite eklatante Fehlplanung ist, dass man die Bluetooth Funktion nicht für einen Fernauslöser  nutzen kann. D.h. man hat nur folgende Möglichkeiten: 1. Auslösen an der Kamera -> Daumen/Hand ist immer gigantisch groß und störend im Bild 2. Auslösen über die Smartphone App -> jedes Mal extra Handy aus der Tasche holen, App starten, auf Verbindung warten, und auf jedem Foto hat man das Handy in der Hand (braucht somit auch immer beide Hände und hat keine mehr frei -> umständlich, und lästig da eine einhändige Benutzung unmöglich ist (mit kleinem Kind unterwegs, oder eine Tasche in der Hand ... unmöglich) 3. Eine überteuerte, schwer erhältliche kabelgebundene Fernbedienung von Ricoh -> kabelgebunden? geht’s noch? Wir schreiben das Jahr 2017, nicht 1917! Die Kamera benutzt auch keinen Film mehr... Ärgerlich, da alles an Hardware vorhanden und eingebaut ist, was man für wesentlich elegantere und praktischere Lösungen brauchte: 4. Einen kleinen billigen Bluetooth-Fernauslöser (am besten direkt integriert in einen Selfiestick, den sieht man am Foto nicht und man hat keine skurrile Riesen-Hand formatfüllend im Foto) direkt via Bluetooth mit der Kamera verbinden 5. Als Notlösung (aber immer noch viel besser als die aktuell möglichen Varianten 1-3) den Fernauslöser mit dem Handy verbinden, und die Theta App würde diesen als Auslöser akzeptieren wie nahezu jede Kamera App. Dann könnte das Handy in der Tasche bleiben, und man bräuchte nur eine Hand (BT-Auslöser am Griff des Selfie-Stick) 6. Über die Mikrofon-Buchse auslösen (mit entsprechenden massenhaft verfügbaren Selfiesticks, die über statt mit Bluetooth über die Kopfhörerbuchse des Smartphones verbunden werden (praktisch, da kein Akku/Batterie leer werden kann, aber kleines Kabel im Bild) Eigentlich könnten alle Kritikpunkte mit einem kleinen Update der App bzw. der Kamerafirmware behoben werden, dann gäbe es 4 Sterne (1 Abzug wegen der Bildqualität). Ich bezweifle aber, dass Ricoh das machen wird...

productreview.author: Carlos
productreview.review: Digamos que soy un usuario experimentado. Tengo una Samsung 360, una Nikon 360 y ahora he comprado esta Theta que me tiene sorprendido. Conecta inmediatamente, pasa las fotos con gran rapidez y es muy cómoda de transportar. Al contrario de la Nikon, el software es muy seguro y eficaz. En fin , un diez , vista la madiocridad de las otras.

productreview.author: MontyBest
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 28, 2018
productreview.review: The cameras only real problem is that it has no external SD card and no replaceable battery. The results are really quite acceptable. Most images video or stills have a pinkish flare spotted in the image. I have no hesitation recommending this camera to someone who wants to put their toe into the 360 degree camera world.

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 27, 2020
productreview.review: Bought to create Virtual Tours.  Picture quality is excellent (4k and HDR) but battery life is short and no Micro SD slot (but can transfer photos directly to mobile via the camera's built-in wi-fi).

productreview.author: Digital Vibe
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 14, 2020
productreview.review: The camera started out fine, however with more use you could clearly see lens issues in the images and also the connection to the camera became quite poor to the point it wouldn’t work. Hopefully this is just a once off so I’ve returned this one and ordered a replacement. However I have heard of the same issues when your research online.

productreview.author: CINCO COMA SEIS IMAGEN
productreview.review: ESPERO QUE ESTE COMENTARIO LLEGUE A RICOH. Después de 3 devoluciones, ahora estoy probando la cuarta y creo que también la devolveré. Sigue el mismo problema. En todas las Webs no hay más que elogios acerca de esta cámara, solamente puedo decir que es IMPRESENTABLE !!!. ZONAS TOTALMENTE DESENFOCADAS. MOVIDAS. SIN NITIDEZ. Supongo que debe ser una serie de fabricación defectuosa, (pero debe ser una serie muy grande, porque a mí me están tocando todas). RICOH no debe disponer de un Departamento de Calidad. O, si lo tiene, será más fácil, dejarlas pasar y que sean los propios compradores los que se encarguen de realizarlo y colocar las cámaras defectuosas en el mercado y seguro que un alto porcentaje cuelan. Por mi parte estoy "MUY INDIGNADO", y siento una enorme impotencia, pues realmente necesito una cámara de estas caractrísticas para unos trabajos sencillos. Me parece increíble que sea yo el único que comenta y reclama esto. Volveré a pasar la verguenza de tener que devolverla por otra y esperar que alguna me toque bien. Por parte de Amazon, el servicio es IMPECABLE !!!. Y espero que las molestias o gastos que esto le ocasione, sepan comprenderlo.

productreview.author: Klaus Zettler
productreview.review: Ich besitze bereits die Theta S und habe heute die Theta V getestet. Aufnahme mit niedrigster ISO Stufe vom Stativ bei schattigem Wetter indoor. Bei meinem Test habe ich (unfairerweise) das Sigma 15mm Fisheye, die Theta S und die Theta V gegenübergestellt (siehe Bildanhang). Das Ergebnis: Natürlich können die Thetas bei der Bildqualität nicht mal annähernd mit dem Fisheye Objektiv mithalten. Interessanter für mich ist jedoch, dass sich die Bildqualität der Theta V nicht wirklich von der der Theta S unterscheidet. Die Bilder der V wirken imho etwas natürlich in der Farbgebung, bieten aber bei Schärfe, Rauschen, etc. keine Verbesserung gegenüber der S. Bei anderen Testschüssen hätte ich der S sogar eine etwas schärfere Darstellung attestiert. Gibt hier sicher auch kleine Schwankungen innerhalb der Modellreihe. Nüchtern betrachtet logisch. Selbes Objektiv bei selber Auflösung -> hier wurde also wahrscheinlich nur etwas an der internen Bildbearbeitung gefeilt. Videoqualität ist für mich uninteressant, da ich die Theta nur für das Erstellen kleiner virtueller Touren im Web brauche. Dafür eignet sich die Kamera ganz gut, da das aufwändige Fotografieren mit Nodalpunktadapter mit anschließendem Stitching entfällt. Für's Web ist die Qualität grundsätzlich auch ganz OK, wenn man Abstriche in Kauf nimmt. Fazit: Gutes, einfach bedienbares Gerät zum schnellen Panorama-Erstellen. Ein Update von der Theta S lohnt sich für Fotografen aber definitiv nicht.

productreview.author: IXOR D.
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 8, 2019
productreview.review: - Battery is dying fast - Quality is ok - not close to pro level cameras - Very easy to carry - Android app - after firmwire update seems to be better - had connecting issues - 360 stick is not perfect- has a visible stick area - for the money ok - VR cameras need to catch up in terms of image quality - since you need minimum 8k if you want to see on 1080p VR. Don't think that 4k is big because this is wrapping around a 360 dome or a cubic VR. So, in reality, a 4k = 1k in normal resolution!

productreview.author: Al Villamar
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 28, 2018
productreview.review: The camera is very easy to use and the photos are very clear and sharp.  The transfer of photos to a PC via the USB cable is easy and fast.  The only minor dislike is the size of the power, wireless, and mode buttons - there are very small and have to use my fingernails to press on them.  The camera looks well made and feels solid.  I have had the camera for a few days and haven't had a chance to make any videos or tried all the settings.  I am very happy with my purchase.

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 9, 2020
productreview.review: I use this camera for skateboarding clips. If you have the selfie stick for it it’s great for getting angles around big ramps as you can just hold it up and you’ll capture what you need. It also works with the insta360 studio app which has tracking and camera animation features.

productreview.author: graham
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 27, 2018
productreview.review: a wonderful camera. Really pleased with it. Great quality and works well on wifi and as a hotspot from my phone. All pictures are uploaded direct to Google Photos so no storage problems.

productreview.author: mike dow
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 6, 2020
productreview.review: This is a fab camera for making 360 tours  very easy to work

productreview.author: Federico Z.
productreview.review: L'ho comprata in offerta e usata per qualche settimana, già dai primi attimi impugnandola ho notato che il prodotto è molto solido e ben fatto, ma non è tutto oro ciò che luccica! Di fatti prossimamente vedrete i contro che sono per me molto più dei pro. Uso dell'App: Appena configurato la camera con il mio Smartphone ho subito notato che si bloccava e dava non pochi problemi di trasmissione dati, ho prontamente aggiornato la camera ma nulla è cambiato. Lasciando un uso quasi fastidioso dell'applicazione essendo molto instabile. Qualità Foto/Video: Onestamente dai video visti online tutti ne parlavano bene, io da smartphone vedevo che non era nulla di c'è ma immaginando fosse solo una bassa qualità dell'anteprima ho fatto vari test, poi scaricando le immagini e i video nel pc ho visto che era anche peggio. Paragonabili a Smartphone di 5o6anni fa... Grande delusione. Archiviazione: la fotocamera ha solo un archivio interno non espandibile di circa 19gb, che permettono circa 2h di video in fullhd e migliaia di fotografie, unica pecca praticamente è molto complesso gestire il file 360, pur essendo un professionista del settore i file hanno un codec che complica ogni cosa anche con pc molto prestanti. Durata: questo come la limitazione dell'archiviazione è l'ennesimo tasto dolente, la batteria non si può cambiare essendo integrata, e ha la durata media di circa 40/50min a secondo degli usi. Inoltre la fotocamera non può essere ricaricata durante il suo stesso utilizzo, sarebbe stati utilissimo poterlo fare attraverso un powerbank. Pro? è molto rubusta ed è fornito di un pratico astuccio protettivo. (a mio dispiacere non trovo altro) Conclusioni: non vi consiglio di prenderla almeno che non siete amatori e non avete particolari esigenze di alta qualità, io l'avevo presa per sfruttarla a lavoro e per viaggi, l'ho prontamente restituita e prossimamente prenderò la Insta360 One X, costa 100€ in più ma ha batterie intercambiabili e alloggiamento per microsd.

products.title: Revant Replacement Lenses for Oakley Fives Squared

productreview.author: MJ
productreview.review: Polarized Black Chrome finish (non Elite series) Cons: - fit in frames is too tight. Much, much harder to install/remove than stock lenses - very thin compared to stock lenses - lenses are not truly black (slight green tint) - cloudy, muddy image - terrible contrast - "black chrome" finish isn't even remotely close to the "black iridium" they are trying to copy from Oakley lenses. Eyes totally visible through the lenses. Pros: - customer service is great - polarized Conclusion: At the end of the day, either spend double the money on the official Oakley replacement lenses, or spend $15-20 on some other brand because these are awful for the money. I have only tested the regular (non-Elite series) lenses. The Elite's may be free from issues but at that price, I would rather just buy the OEM ones.

productreview.author: Steven Wong
productreview.review: Bought these lenses after my original polarized lenses got all scratched up from years of use.  I compared them directly with a friend's new pair of Oakley's and although these are really good, they don't compare.  The originals seem to have better contrast as well as overall less light transmission, with my eyes feeling more relaxed but with a clearer image if that makes any sense.  At this price point, however, I would wholly recommend these, just know that they're not going to be a perfect replacement for the originals.

productreview.author: Julian Shea
productreview.reviewTitle: Strange mirroring on the inside of the lens
productreview.review: Nice lenses, very clear, but the lens that I ordered was a very light brown which is ok, especially for not super bright days. But the inside of the lens has some sort of strange blue mirroring.. seems like it shouldn't be there because on bright days you get a strange blue dot in your vision unless the sunglasses are so tight on your face that no light comes in the side of the glasses. Its pretty obnoxious. Not sure I'd order again

productreview.author: cale
productreview.review: Bought a pair to replace original Oakley lenses, the ones that arrived were distorted. Revant customer serviced provided with a second set of lenses, however they also arrived with the same distortion issue. Think of when you change prescription on eyeglasses and your eyes are trying to adjust, that's what they felt like however my eyes never did adjust. Neither my other Oakley or Maui Jim glasses give me this problem, it's definitely the product. Great customer service, wish the product I received was the same quality.

productreview.author: Jae
productreview.review: Amazing lenses.  These are my second pair from "Revant".  Great polorized lenses,  Hard to scratch.  Why spend more for real Oakley lenses when these are cheaper,polorized and fit exactly inside my frames.  Easy install/always fit.  I work on a river in summer and ski hill winter.  These hold up.

productreview.author: PeeBee
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 15, 2018
productreview.review: After reading a number of less than sterling reviews, I wasn't expecting a lot from these lenses, but the original lenses in my Oakley Fives Squareds had seen better days, having provided nearly a decade's use. However, having dropped them a few times, the lenses were a little scratched. I didn't want to throw the sunglasses away and replacement original lenses were about the same price as a new pair of (discounted) sunglasses, so I thought I'd give these Revants a try. I bought the polarising Titanium mirror shield, replacing non-polarising smoke grey lenses. The replacements are a perfect fit (which is the least you should expect given the quality of modern tooling), but I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the lenses. They certainly feel light - subjectively lighter than the originals, but that's not to say they feel cheap. The lenses provide at least as much shade as the originals, but are also clearer (potentially due to the build up large and micro-scratches on the older lenses) and have much better contrast than the original (non-polarised) lenses. I was a bit skeptical based on some reviews here, which is why I felt I should leave this review. I couldn't be happier - I hope to get another decade out of my Oakleys and would happily recommend these replacement lenses.

productreview.author: Dougal22
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 11, 2015
productreview.review: A little disappointing, but I guess you get what you pay for. These are not anything like the quality of genuine Oakley lenses, but they're a fraction of the price. They're good enough for most situations and fit perfectly. But where I find they let me down is coping with e.g. low sun glare on wet roads where they can cause a sort of "grey out" effect. My scratched old Oakley lenses dealt with anything and even sharp sunlight didn't distort the overall  clarity, but these are definitely not as good. But if you want cheap replacement lenses for your Oakley frames which are for occasional use then these are fine.

productreview.review: fit is crack on, lenses ar good but not quite up to oakley original standard, when i say this i dont really mean in optical performance, but with quality of mirror coatings arnt, to the depth of an oakley lens, you can still see eye's through lens mirror coatings, i own this lens colour in another pair of oakleys and its just not as high a standard as those, but hey ho, for the price cannot really complain
