products.title: BAGSMART 3-Layer Large Travel Cable Organizer Bag Electronics Accessories Case for 9.7" iPad, Kindle, Cables, Chargers, Batteries, USB Drives, Gray and Orange

productreview.author: Ame
productreview.reviewTitle: Very pleased with this travel case.
productreview.review: I don't have a lot of technical stuff to take so this bag is perfect for me.  It will hold up to six cords and has 3 small pouches and two large zippered pouches for larger items like chargers.  It lies very flat which is what I wanted for travel.  A nice surprise was that it came with velcro ties - 4 in red, green, blue and yellow.  There is a small slot for a sim card or other small item. The only thing I noticed was that the two inside zippers were flimsy.  One zipper actually pulled apart in the middle as I was inspecting it but I was able to get it back together.  The outside zipper seems fine.  This bag was inexpensive so I am not surprised.  I will keep it because I won't be putting anything too big in those pouches. It is made in China but as long as it does what I need it to I am fine with that.

productreview.author: Philipp zu Putlitz
productreview.reviewTitle: There are a few things I would have liked to see but they aren't a deal breaker
productreview.review: This Organizer bag is actually quite helpful especially when on the go. There are a few things I would have liked to see but they aren't a deal breaker. For one there aren't many sd, microsd or tf card pouches which would have been nice to have considering the USB Drive compartments work like a charm. Overall the size is quite good, the material seems durable, and the zipper does seem sturdy. That being said it will take some time of usage before that will show its weakness. The cable organizer section and battery pouch are actually very good. It took me a while to figure out how they'd like me to use some of the pouches and straps (little to no information sent with it) but that wasn't a big issue in the end of it. Currently, I'd recommend this product.

productreview.author: Violeta M.
productreview.reviewTitle: This organizer was amazing. It fit all my wires for my phone
productreview.review: This was absolutely life-saving product! I desperately needed to find a case that fit all of my electronics (especially because airport security always needs this in one bag). This organizer was amazing. It fit all my wires for my phone, iPod, gopro, and external battery charger. It fit my usb and SD cards perfectly (none of them ever fell out, which is what i was worried about). I think the best part about this item is the depth of it. I was able to fit my gopro camera case, an external battery charger, gopro battery charger ((for 2 batteries). I then squeezed in my gopro camera right at the front in the pocket. I would definitely recommend buying this product to anyone out there looking for an organizer!

productreview.author: smc
productreview.reviewTitle: I like this bag - so handy!
productreview.review: This bag came quickly and I really find it helpful for organizing all my charging cords (iPhone, ipad, spare battery charging cords), spare batteries for the electronics and USB flashdrives.  It also holds my ipad mini no problem.  It does not fit my mac book air charging cord but that is because I have stuffed so much other electronic pieces into it.  I love it.  It is so easy to just pull this bag out when going through security at the airport as well as when getting to my seat on the plane.  Lots of people have asked where I got it since it is so handy to have all this little cords and supplies in one handy place.  You do have to be careful that the elastic will loosen over time so be careful when opening it to make sure nothing has shifted.  Nice and slim and fits in my backpack when travelling.

productreview.author: Timour Savine
productreview.review: the bag is well made, i had a slight problem with the zippers, however the seller was very responsive and the problem was resolved by replacing the item with another one that had everything working just fine. the bag is not of a very big size, however everything that was normally bouncing on the bottom of my over-the-shoulder bag and around my car has nicely fit it and now seems organized. i am very pleased with the way the seller responded to my complain about zippers, eventhough it hasn't been a disastrous defect. i totally recommend the item to those in need of a mid-sized electronic accessories organizer.

productreview.author: Aaron D
productreview.review: PROS 1) Quality Build: good stiching with strong zipper. 2) Multiple Configurations: lots of options for small cables, large power blocks and everything in between. 3) Versatile: can be used to store a variety items ranging from electronics to school supplies. 4) Ample Space: large enough to carry electronics to meet the needs of 5 people. CONS 1) Plastic protection film difficult to remove.

productreview.author: Jeffrey Clement
productreview.reviewTitle: This is built pretty well. My only real complaint is the size
productreview.review: This is built pretty well.  My only real complaint is the size.  Thought things would fit a little better.  Its missing about 1/2'' to 1'' width.  Most wires just fit if you squeeze them in.  I would recommend this if you just have a few things you are carrying.  But if your like me and have an ereader, memory cards, charging cable, earphones, card reader, battery pack, and a few other small electronic devices then you may want to look at a larger case.  Otherwise this one just might do the trick

productreview.author: BlueZoom09
productreview.reviewTitle: Perfect to organized all your cables for travelling
productreview.review: Perfect addition to organize all your cables, SD Cards, USBs, charging cables, and chargers - all in one compact package. Glad I got the larger one for the extra room and it doesn't feel "too big".  While this was initially intended for travel, I'm thinking I will keep everything stored in here all the time so that I'm not searching for my various cables.

productreview.author: R.Stock
productreview.review: If you're like me and have a lot of thumb-drives and cables etc then this book is for you.. Being organized is a great feeling and nothing worse than have a spiders nest of wires. Great gifts for anyone who has a lot of dongles and sort.. Price is good and so is the quality. highly recommend this to anyone who has clutter in their life

productreview.author: Ramona
productreview.review: I have several electronics and accessories that I'd like to keep in the same place, and I travel with them as well. Fits my mouse, external hard drive, huge power bank, surface charger, iPad, headphones case, misc cables and still room for more. My husband is the same so he had me order one for himself. Just got it yesterday so not sure what the wear and tear will be like.

productreview.author: Patrick L.
productreview.reviewTitle: Organize your cables, adapters and more
productreview.review: You know all those cables you acquire all twisted and bunched up like the Christmas lights in the Christmas Vacation movie, well start organizing. Now can find the cable I need when I need it. I also include all my various adapters and charging cables. I should have done this sooner. Check that the size of this case works for you. I felt that it was a tad smaller then I was expecting.

productreview.author: Kunal
productreview.review: Rating this 5 Stars, because everything is accurate about it as per description and specs.  However, from the pictures I was expecting it to be a little thicker than it actually is.  Specs on the site is correct, however be advised that the pics make it look thicker than it actually is.  Other than the size, I rate it 5/5.  I really wanted something a little bigger though :(

productreview.author: Andrea
productreview.review: this is an amazing little electronics bag. The best one I've had. so much room for everything and keeps the clutter away! The first one i got had a flaw in the mesh so I've returned it, got a refund and ordered another no problem all in 3 days. i will be buying the smaller version as well!

productreview.author: Simon
productreview.review: My only issue is the design of the bag makes the interior dimensions actually smaller than advertised. I did purchase a larger bag from same company and seller. The sticking on the bags is nice, clean and well done. I would definitely continue to buy the BAGSMART products.

productreview.author: Nodscene
productreview.reviewTitle: etc in order and easily accessible. I tend to have a lot of ...
productreview.review: The only downside is that it is smaller than I thought it would be. I know it gave dimensions but still looks smaller than the pictures. Haven't measured the bag itself but I'm sure it matches the description. I can't say anything about longevity as I've only had it for a while now. The bag does work as intended and helps keep all my cables, charges, etc in order and easily accessible. I tend to have a lot of electronic items on me when I travel and it pretty much fits everything I need although it's not bug enough to also include my laptop cable and power brick or mouse. Could be a couple inches bigger in each dimension, at least for me. Excellent purchase so far and I recommend it for anyone who carries a lot of electronic peripherals.

productreview.author: Paul Andre Lallier
productreview.review: Package arrived quickly and in good condition.  The bag appears to be of good construction.  Only issue I have, and it's my own problem, is that it is a little smaller than I expected.  USB cables just bunch up more in the smaller space, but I have only a few so not a big concern.

productreview.author: Wiser Owl
productreview.reviewTitle: As advertised: Well-built travel bag that organizes small electronics
productreview.review: This is a cool little bag that seems to be well built. Organizes a variety of cables and small electronics, putting them within sight - much nicer than digging through a tangle of cords to find the one you're looking for. Love that the sides have enough depth to accommodate all the items zipped inside; exterior pocket and pouches are also appreciated. Very happy with this purchase.

productreview.author: Brett
productreview.review: Feels premium.  I can throw this in my backpack and takes care of all my cables charges etc.  I was skeptical about it fitting my Ipad (9.7") and slim folio with it full of a portable ssd, cables etc but it fits!  I will probably try other bagsmart products if they are like this.

productreview.author: John
productreview.review: I bought this bag to hold my tech stuff and it does a pretty good job at it. It has plenty of pockets and compartments to hold everything I need. I store charging cables, spare phone batteries, my earbuds, flash drives and my portable hard drive in here. My only issue is that the row of little pockets on the inside are too small to hold many things. If you need a bag to hold your tech I definitely suggest this one. If you want a more in depth look at the bag I suggest you go to YouTube and search uravgconsumer tech survival kit 2.0. I would recommend this bag to anyone looking to hold their tech.

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.review: Bagsmart created a great media /electronic travel bag organizer.  It’s like a mini briefcase.  I am able to put my iPad, iPhone, portable GPS & beanbag stand for it, as well as all the charger cords nicely into this Bagsmart.  This organizer is still compact enough to slip into a purse or carry-on luggage and everything is all together in one place.  Excellent product for travelling:  Love it ❤️

productreview.author: Benoit Rainville
productreview.review: I'm using this bag to store all my smaller accessories for field photography and travel abroad. It can take a lt of small to medium size gadgets and accessories, wires, batteries, memory cards, USB drives, filters, etc. The design is great, quality is impeccable, the fabric and the zippers will last for sure.

productreview.author: Warren S.
productreview.reviewTitle: Overall, what I had hoped for. A little smaller than I expected.
productreview.review: After reviewing a bunch of competitors, I felt like this was the product being compared to, which was what made my decision. It looks strong so far. Good quality and build. Good strong zippers, materials, and stitching. There's one photo in the product photos of the Bagsmart being stuffed into a backpack which made it look bigger than it is. I almost didn't buy it because it looked too big from my needs. I decided I could crush it down if need be, but it looks like that won't be an issue. So far, happy with this purchase.

productreview.author: Mikayla Fisher
productreview.review: Bought this as our last trip was a cluster of cords and chargers. These types of bags have come a long ways, suspected them to be poorly laid out but I was very impressed. We fit a large inverter power bar, tablet, all our cords, memory cards, and charging bricks in here with room to spare, Super cool!

productreview.author: sdt1
productreview.review: A very well made bag, which holds a surprising amount of cords! I could have gone up one size to hold all my cords, but I still managed to fit it all into this smaller model....just a little tight. This is great for home cord storage and travel/business.

productreview.author: Jay
productreview.review: Great little bag. You will notice when it arrives this is worth about $10 at most. lots of great spots for all small cables and headphones. Mine has small usb brick for iphone, 4 charging cords, 2 earbuds, travel power adapter, 4000mah power bank, aux cord, ground loop isolator, pens, and usb flash drive.

productreview.reviewTitle: Seems relatively durable. I should have gotten a bigger ...
productreview.review: Seems relatively durable. I should have gotten a bigger size as this is very tight. Labels should be more generic as not everyone carries SD cards with them (I have more USB sticks for example). Other than that, it keeps stuff neat in one spot. Just what the doctor ordered.

productreview.author: Highland Lass
productreview.reviewTitle: Great bag for techno supplies and cords
productreview.review: This bag is perfect size for traveling and also just to use around the house. It holds plenty of cords, adapters and extras and is well made with water proof type nylon material. I am planning to buy a couple more.

productreview.author: Tori
productreview.review: This bag is amazing! It's so small yet so well laid out and compact. It provides a crazy amount of organization. Would definitely recommend this bag to anyone who travels regularly or works mobile or goes to school. Would be a rest organizer in a car or something like that as well. Awesome product.

productreview.author: J. L. Harper
productreview.review: Bought for my husband who is a professional camera man for all his little pieces, cords, and parts. He loves it. I wish there was a really big version like the size of a backpack, I’d buy that too!

productreview.author: Tinker & Rove
productreview.reviewTitle: It amazing how much this little bag can hold
productreview.review: I work in event production and need to travel with a zillion little cables and adapters regularly, and this keeps them organized so I can find exactly what I'm looking for in seconds. It amazing how much this little bag can hold, and its made more than a few of my nerd friends jealous. Very satisfied.

productreview.author: Mark
productreview.review: I was wondering if this would be big enough but was surprised at what it fit. I have not traveled with it yet so not positive about durability but to look and feel it seems good. It is going to take a beating because it will be in my motorcycle all the time

productreview.author: Shay M.
productreview.review: I bought this for an overseas trip. I could fit most of my accessories in the bag. It helps to have everything in one place and works as advertised. I will probably buy a bigger case so i can pack some larger components in a secure and convenient package.

productreview.author: rappar
productreview.reviewTitle: Good value, lots of storage space
productreview.review: This provides plenty of space for the cords, etc. that anyone needs. And, it takes up little space in luggage. A very useful purchase.

productreview.author: Lloyd Cross
productreview.review: I received the wrong bag.  After my review I was contacted by Ellie at Ecosusi Inc and she corrected the order, I am very pleased with the bag and commend the customer service and the product is excellent.  The bag is built well and holds all the stuff I need for travel.  Thanks

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.review: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She is a bit of an organization freak and this unit was perfect. It will hold her smart phone, cables charging station and a small tablet(samsung 9 inch, would not suggest for anything larger) It is very compact with smart styling and it seems to be made out of durable fabric. Excellent purchase

productreview.author: Mike J
productreview.review: This is much smaller than anticipated and it is difficult to use the elastic straps . Hard to pack it effectively. The side panels bend when packed. It would be better if deeper and more rigid.

productreview.author: Rich
productreview.review: It's a great bag for organizing. Holds a lot more than expected and keeps my cords in an orderly fashion in my computer bag. The bag is deep which is nice to hold a couple of chargers as well.

productreview.author: Nancy
productreview.review: A little smaller then I expected but lots of slots, pockets and elastic straps to secure and store things. Should work just fine.

productreview.author: ASWhizbang
productreview.reviewTitle: Love the case, lots of room!
productreview.review: Love this case, it holds everything I have and more!!  My husband adds his stuff to my case when we travel together.  Talking Ipad mini, wireless speakers, battery charger, two kindles and lots of cables.

productreview.author: Ryan Cook
productreview.review: It’s a perfect little travel bag and does fit a lot of stuff. Only complaint is that actetically could be more visually pleasing. Also, it’s very bulky when loaded w stuff and doesn’t easily fit into luggage. It’s heavy.

productreview.author: David T
productreview.review: Really like this bag. It’s big but not too big. Can fit all the chargers for my ipad pro and various tech. Love it.

productreview.author: Hugo Henry
productreview.reviewTitle: Étui comportant plusieurs compartiments, parfait pour les voyages.
productreview.review: Très belle étui que j’utilise pour mes voyages et qui conviens parfaitement à tous mes accessoires pour mon iPhone XR ainsi qu’à mon IPad Très bonne qualité et de parfaite grandeur. Je vous le recommande !!!!!

productreview.author: B Andrews
productreview.review: I love this bag, we use it on long and short haul trips. It fits all the cables and keeps them organized. It fits an i pad mini or an ereader nicely as well as memory cards, cables etc.

productreview.author: Chuck
productreview.reviewTitle: I t has a good number of storage spaces
productreview.review: Looks like it will be good to travel with, would be better with a shoulder strap has only had carry strap

productreview.author: Jo
productreview.review: grand espace et très facile pour ranger nombres de câbles.  le rangement pour la tablette est vraiment genial, avec le charger et le cable, on a tout sous la main,

productreview.author: S. Pateman
productreview.reviewTitle: Didn't meet my needs, but was good.
productreview.review: Should have known it would be quite flat. Wanted to get something to also put my GoPro Session in while backpacking. Great cord storage though, I liked how it was organized. Returned. Quick and easy refund.

productreview.author: Elie Moreault
productreview.review: Nice bag to keep all electronics at the same place. I travel a lot and it's been very useful to have all my stuff in the same bag. Lots of room for cables, tablets, SD cards, external battery, etc.

productreview.author: Heather Fuchs
productreview.reviewTitle: Great Bag for all sorts of storage needs
productreview.review: This bag is sturdy and amazing, now I will be honest, I don’t use it for the intended purpose. My toddler is a Type 1 Diabetic and when we are going to be away from home for a few days, the storage you can have in this bag, especially if you are still MDI is amazing!!!

productreview.author: Kenn Crawford
productreview.review: Lots of storage options and very versatile. My only complaint is the flap for the outside pockets is narrower than the pocket itself - it should at least be the same size so you know your devices are safe and free from accidental scratches/damage when travelling with it and other gear in the same bag.

productreview.author: TJ SwimDad
productreview.reviewTitle: This is a very good product - well-made, good fit and finish.
productreview.review: Great product. Soft, but well-made. Not as large as you would think but large enough to store ALL of my cables, wires, mouse, etc. No more loose tech junk cluttering my backpack... Thank you!

productreview.author: SensOfficeRalph
productreview.review: Better than discribed.  Great quality hold lots and lots of gadgets, cables and power banks.  Great travel companion.

products.title: WayinTop Electronics Component Fun Kit w/E-Book, Upgraded Electronic Starter Kit with Breadboard Jumper Wires Kit, PCB Soldering Kit, LEDs & Resisitor Kit for Arduino/Raspberry pi/ESP32/ESP8266

productreview.author: Uzziah
productreview.review: As you can clearly see from the image I attached, most of the breadboard holes are misaligned, you'd have to force-push components to barely get them in...and you risk bending them (like shown in the image). I don't have issues with the other components of the kit, but the breadboard is terrible.

productreview.author: SOMESSI Basile
productreview.review: Liste au complet produit et qualité  prix acceptable . Merci

productreview.author: Christopher IXer
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
productreview.review: You have to email the company for a PDF file to get the instructions.  The packaging is ridiculous.  Talk about cramming 10 pounds of crap in a 5 pound bag.  Not to mention when I was opening the box the kit fell from my coffee table to a shag carpet floor and the plastic case shattered like I dropped a Christmas ornament on a concrete floor.  That was a freaking mess.  I had to go buy a little parts case from the hardware store.  So add another $7 to the kit right there. The whole thing is geared toward Arduino learning, but it doesn't come with and Arduino board and the AD on Amazon doesn't really tell you that it doesn't come with an Arduino Board.  Maybe it does tell you, but I do not have 3 hours to research an electronics learning tool.  I personally didn't learn that the whole thing was worthless without the Arduino board until I placed the order and finally received the PDF file.  It also requires an uncommon USB cable to power it up.  I am sure there is a reason for that, but they don't provide the cable or any adapters so you are on a search for an uncommon cable that you have to BUY or rig one up yourself (which is what I did with 2 old cell phone chargers).  I had to cut 2 cords off the cell phone chargers and splice them together.  Sorry Wayin Top, but I do not recommend your product.  Not to mention the shipment got lost in the mail.  I finally got it about 2 weeks after the original delivery date promised. Buy a kit with the Arduino board and instructions included.  This one has been nothing but delay after delay. I had to wait for: Wait for the shipment.  Wait for the PDF email with the instructions (that's freaking ridiculous).  Search for an uncommon power cord or make your own.  Wait for that to come in if you buy it.  Search for an Arduino board.  Pay and wait for the Arduino board.  Who knows what else I will have to search and wait for.  100% disappointed.  This was a gift for my son's birthday.  he is interested in RC, robotics, and drone technology.  The shipment missed his birthday and it wouldn't have mattered anyway because we had no power supply or instructions when it finally did show up.

productreview.author: Cat
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
productreview.review: This kit includes a lot of essential components for a low price, but there is a noticeable lack of quality. A few examples: - Some of the jumpers have leftover injection molded pieces hanging on near the ends, so you have to snip those off or else they will get in the way. The jumpers are also quite thin, so thin that my cat chomped one in half with one bite. - The breadboard terminals are often difficult to get connected. Some of them are loose and your wires will accidentally slip out, some are very stiff and you have to use a lot of force to get it to snap in (sometimes bending your component in the process). - The resistors are poorly labelled and the striping system used to determine how many Ohms it has is not the typical system. Besides these issues, it works OK and I like the little box it comes with to keep everything together. The difficulty of the breadboard is really annoying though, so that's the main reason I'm only giving it 3 stars.

productreview.author: The purchaser😈
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020
productreview.review: N0T FOR BEGINNERS. get a kit you know has reliable items. COUNTERFIT 555 timer.  The precut wires are SOFT but are definitely usable. Breadboard is cheap. Falls apart easily and the inner metal parts get pushed out the bottom because its just paper not even a hard base on the back side. Wires can easily move around in side and short on other rails. And just wiggling the board makes the leds I have set up flicker like crazy. Bad connections over all. Resistors need to be tested individually because they do not match their label. Potentiometer does not work. So if you buy a new breadboard, 555timer and multimeter this is good for the caps LEDs, and wires.

productreview.author: Shannon Parker
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
productreview.review: So far so good. A good beginner electronics set with a lot of options for electronic projects. Main thing that would make it better would be a dual male USB cable for USB power.

productreview.author: Sandeep Khare
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
productreview.review: Bought it for my kid's school project and it helped a lot. She was able to test the circuit at home. The kit has all the basic components which are used in STEM school's projects. We had  great fun. Only wished that it had few sample circuit diagrams which we could use as reference. Overall i would recommend it to every STEM school kid

productreview.author: Robert James Guerra
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020
productreview.review: its got almost everything I need for my Arduino fun except I do wish it had come with Mosfits but it doesn't matter 5 stars!  oh and if you want the instructions you can download it right here on this page  under Technical Specifications

productreview.author: jonathan pecany
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
productreview.review: This item is good for its value, it includes almost everything, all of it work as I am aware of. For any beginners, make sure you put a resistor to the positive from a LED light because it can decrease the life span of it. It is a good value as well, it is quite cheap for including almost everything, one of the good products I bought.

productreview.review: I was looking for a set of items for my new robot/raspberry project. I came across this set with everything I needed. This set comes in a nice box, very well organized and labeled, specially resistors. I haven't test everything but so far so good.

productreview.author: Belinda

productreview.review: Everything works as expected.

productreview.review: The kit has multiple high quality components. Every single component functioned fine. Would definitely recommend.

products.title: iSpring ED2000 Whole House Electronic Descaler Water Conditioner, Alternative Water Softener

productreview.author: Bob M
productreview.review: Product arrived quickly and was easy to install. Now been five or six weeks since installation. My well water hardness is 21 grains. There has been some improvement. Water feels softer in shower. Rate of hard water scale is diminished, however still getting lime scale build up in electrical kettle. Not as fast as before, but still need to use vinegar to clean it. Manufacturer says to wait three months for full effect. For an inexpensive descaler it seems ok, time will tell. I suspect water that is less hard than mine responds better to the unit. I may still go out and purchase a water softener..... UPDATE Aug 17 2020. I have removed this unit after over a year of service. I really can't see any difference. My hardness ranges between 17 and 21.

productreview.author: Boots89
productreview.review: I got this because of build up in my coffee maker once I install it still waiting for coffee to ask me to clean it been 2 months. Works great!!!!

productreview.author: Johanne
productreview.reviewTitle: Enlève complètement le calcaire dans votre eau
productreview.review: Wouw ça marche tout de suite, plus de calcaire dans notre eau. Nos appareils finissent de se nettoyer tranquillement. On aurait dû faire ça depuis très longtemps. Je le qualifi de simple et très efficace. Mon époux à eu des pierres aux reins et le médecin disait qu c'était souvent à cause du calcaire dans l'eau.

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.review: Very effective in removing scale build-up from pipes.  It does take about 6 months to see the full effect but initially, you may notice a black scale occasionally coming out of the faucets.  You may need to occasionally remove the aerators and turn the faucet on full to let the black scale drain out so the aerators don't become clogged.  I have seen an increase in flow and pressure.  The water is more pleasant and soap lathers more readily.

productreview.review: At first it seemed to be working, but maybe that was just in my head. I will have to try moving it and reinstalling it another way to see if anything will improve it

productreview.review: Not sure if it’s working. Still hard to clean hard water stains.

productreview.author: Picky Pete
productreview.review: I noticed an immediate difference  in my water.  More suds, no more scale.  Just fine powder which wipes away easily.  pre-existing scale broke up and dissipated.  I also added an iSpring whole house filter to remove small particulate matter and my water is now excellent.  I no longer have to de-scale my espresso machine.

productreview.author: Patti
productreview.reviewTitle: Product has given this woman wonderful soft hair
productreview.review: Noticed a difference with the water within a week or two.  The hard water has in the past left me with dry coarse hair.  Now I am happy to say my hair (which has been coloured for 30 years) is soft and manageable.  Product is easy to install and no more scale in the kettle.

productreview.author: michael whitehead
productreview.review: its been 2 + weeks ... i'm thinking does this thing work ?  no evidence it does, kettle still scaling up.

productreview.author: Arturo Rubi
productreview.review: Muy buen producto me gusto

productreview.author: Tester
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
productreview.review: Measured hardness professionally  before installing. It was 210 - very hard. Will come back to this feedback every week to see changes and report. For tight spaces you have to know the length of the coil before installation. On 3/4" pipe it's 4.25". Also you don't know if you can cross red and blue wires as they come out of the box because in my setup water flow is from right to left. So my box is facing wall not to cross them. In seven days hardness dropped to 160 ppm. Will be coming back to this once a week to tell what changed. Second week brought hardness to 140 ppm. Manual is saying though that unit "will not affect hardness measured by traditional test" and with this type of water conditioner the results can be measured by observing changes in scale forming areas. So I'll report any changes as I see them. In three weeks it's 130 ppm.It looks like the ball on the bottom of my electrical kettle is still shiny, I had to clean it monthly with vinegar or baking soda.

productreview.author: Dustin Loveland
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018
productreview.review: I was skeptical when I bought this but figured it was worth the try.  Easy to install and then just plug it in.  I installed it in the morning and took a shower that night, definitely could tell a difference, soap lathered up more and felt very clean when done.  Within a couple days I noticed less residue in the ice maker and dishwasher.  Its been a couple weeks and the shower heads stopped plugging up and the water heater seems to recover a bit faster.  Its been three weeks and the difference is very noticeable.  If this is all I get out of it then I will be very happy.  Great purchase in my opinion.  I have very hard well water in south texas

productreview.author: Ozark Vegan
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018
productreview.review: (Updated to address claims for 1 month and 3 months) I live in a very small house where there is no room for a full house water softener, so I decided to try this descaler. I placed it on my PEX pipe right before it branched off to its various locations, all well within the 50 foot limit, probably within 30 feet. The installation was simple, as others have mentioned. The most difficult part was laying in a small crawlspace while winding the wires around the pipe. Day 1: More lather - This is the first time I've seen lather since I moved here and this was with the first shower after installation. I knew at that moment that the descaler was working. Week 1: Breaking down scale on water heater heating element and water pipes - My water heater is only a year old, but was losing the ability to maintain hot water. After one week, this issue has been fully resolved. No more lukewarm showers. Week 2: Loosening of scale on faucets and showerheads - My faucets are no longer developing stalactites,  and sink drains are not coated with white, crusty film. 1 Month: Less time for water to heat; reduction of scale on showerheads, pipes, and faucets - I see a noticeable reduction in scale on my showerhead and faucets, and have had no need to clean them beyond general cleaning, no more scraping away crust. I've also seen a significant amount of scale come out of the faucets (I remove and check monthly, with the first month resulting in large chunks of scale). 3 Months (I'm addressing just 2 months in since these issues have already been resolved): Disappearance of scale from showerheads; scaly crust in toilets is significantly reduced and no new crust should form - True on both claims. The most amazing was the total disappearance of scaly crust in the toilet, which has been an annoyance since I lived here. It looks brand new now and requires only normal cleaning. I am very pleased and surprised at this simple solution.  This product has resolved a handful of issues that I've had with hard water. Without room to install a water softener, this little gadget has saved the day.

productreview.author: TypicalConsumer777
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2018
productreview.review: It almost seems too good to be true. We moved into a new house to later find that the municipal water was very hard. Calcium deposits on the dishes, dishwasher, fixtures and shower glass. But the worst part is what it does to your hair. My family was fed up with feeling as if the shampoo never really got out of our hair. I did a ton of research and we don’t have the space for a typical water softener system. So I bought the iSpring ED2000 on Amazon and installed it on the incoming cold water supply under my house. The directions were very straight forward and the whole process was almost too easy. I purposely installed it in a location so I could peek through the crawl space access to make sure the lights are still flickering but that’s about as much maintenance as this thing needs. Amazing! Two weeks after installation, all of the symptoms described above were gone.

productreview.author: yepher
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2018
productreview.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I was originally looking at a typical salt-based water softener solution but I was very reluctant to do that since it needs constant attention for adding/maintaining the salt. I decided to risk the ~$150 on this solution just in case it worked as advertised. I've had the device installed for a little more than 90 days now. I have seen a definite reduction in hard water deposits around my sinks and fixtures. But the bigger indication that this thing actually works are the dishes in the dishwasher. Before I installed this I ran the dishwasher and the glasses would all have a "white" discoloration from the hard water. It was so bad we had stopped using our dishwasher. I just ran the dishwasher on a few loads of dishes and the glasses came out sparkling clear. They looked like new glasses. I honestly did not actually expect this thing to work very well. But happily, I was wrong so now I have no need in my house for the salt-based water softener, thank goodness. An odd thing is I have an electronic water hardness meter that I bought at the same time I got this unit. I measured the hardness of the water before I installed the unit and I've been measuring it every couple of weeks. I've not seen any significant change in that reading but the end result is the annoying bits of hard water are no longer annoying. It claims the inside of the hot water heater and other systems are getting cleared out too. I don't know if that is truly happening or not but based on other external evidence I am inclined to believe it is working there too. I used to help my mom and dad carry those salt bags to their basement and fill the water softener. I am very glad not to have to do that in my house.

productreview.author: Ken N.
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2018
productreview.review: With no expectations of water quality improvement, I installed the ED 2000 per instructions in about an hour. I'm 74 and am done with the heavy bags of salt used in our previous home. Wife bugging me about soap build up on shower glass in current home where there was no softener system. Okay, to keep her from yapping, I told her that an Alternative system was available and I could install it myself. Three days after installation she comes out of shower and says "OMG, my hair feels like I just had a Keratin treatment." I asked "Is that good or bad?" She says, "They charge anywhere from $150 to $300 for that service at the hair dressers." Well, that's a pretty good payback and now I'm Mr. WONDERFUL.  Jury still out on shower glass. Probably takes longer.

productreview.author: Brian and Megan S.
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
productreview.review: So far so good.  The descaler has been installed for one month.  The install was straight forward and easy. As far as the performance: I have this installed in a ranch with a pretty long run between the supply and the water heater (over 50 feet).  I found a video from a spring that says the effectiveness of the ionization only lasts for about 50 feet.  I wish this information was more clearly presented on Amazon and in their install guide. That being said within a few days I felt like I noticed more particles being worked loose from the pipes and water heater.  No drastic improvement yet but water scales do seem to be more of a powder deposit than a scale (my water is hard due almost entirely to calcium). For the price and what it seems to do I think it is worth it.  Do your research and check the run of your pipes first.

productreview.author: Thomas K.
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018
productreview.review: Installed 4 days ago and already noticing small changes in my water. I noticed mine and my daughters hair feels completely different(different in a good way) Our hair feels smoother and less tangles. We did not change our shampoo or conditioner or anything else besides installing the ED2000. I have not noticed descaling at this point but I am sure it will take the approx. recommended time for the process to be as efficient as possible. I will add to the review when it has been installed longer and evaluate the stars at that time. I am Giving this 4 stars only because I have only had it installed for a few days and haven't had enough time to evaluate the final outcome.

productreview.author: ACEY
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
productreview.review: Day one:  Dish washing liquid foams (with hard water, this was unexpected).  Week one:  what looks like mineral buildup, wipes right off.  Week two, the deposits on the inside of my humidifier are falling off!  Deposits on the inside of my kitchen faucett are breaking off.  It's fun to see the positive changes...looking forward to many more!  It works better than I had ever anticipated!

productreview.author: Clint C.
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2020
productreview.review: So I'm a sceptic about this. I live in central Texas. Some of the hardest water in the country. I am very happy. My wife uses an electric kettle to make tea all the time. Before installing this, in only 1 day there would be a white calcium film covering the bottom of the kettle. After a couple days it's a complete layer that needs to be vinigered to be cleaned. I installed this thing and now it takes days, even a week to form the calcium film on the bottom of the kettle. But even more surprising is it doesn't build up. It even keeps self cleaning and knocking off parts of the film down to bare metal. Very cool. My shower head constantly clogged up and I would use my nails to unclog weekly. Since I installed this over a month ago, not a single hole has clogged up. Best of all, no salt.  I'm going to add more wire to see if I can strengthen its affects.

productreview.author: Steve207
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2019
productreview.review: Where I live in So. CA we have really hard water. Per our water report the city water comes in at about 500 TDS. This, of course, leaves white calcium build up all over the shower, appliances, water faucets, etc.  A tried & true solution is a salt-based water softener, however, they are expensive, and our local government has banned them.  Therefore, the only solution is a salt-less system. I looked up a number of high end salt-less systems, but they are $1000+ and seem to have very mixed reviews. As such, I figured at just over $100 the ISpring system seemed like a worthwhile alternative to try out, especially considering their satisfaction guarantee. As such, I went ahead & purchased one & installed it about 6 months ago.  Installation was very easy, just wrap the wires around the incoming water pipe tightly & plug it in.  I also cleaned all the calcium on my faucets & showerheads. Immediately I felt as if the water was a bit softer & the soap a little slicker when showering.  This isn't a huge difference, like a salt system would create, but it does seem that there is a small perceivable difference.  With 6-months under my belt, I can also say that all of my faucet taps & showerheads remain unclogged.  It's hard to say for sure, but I believe before I had this system the small jets on the showerhead would have clogged up well before 6-months after a thorough cleaning. Realizing the system doesn't take any hardness out of the water, but rather, keeps the hardness from adhering to appliances & surfaces is key.  If you don't come into this expecting the results that a salt-system would create, then you'll likely notice the results. In my experience the results aren't enormous, but they do exist & I feel they are worth the relatively small cost of the system.

productreview.author: James R. Knost
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
productreview.review: Company states "The revolutionary technology the conditions hard water and reduces scale build-up".  It states "One Year MONEY BACK" as its warranty.  After 9 months and no visible signs of less scale, I now have to replace this with a more traditional water treatment system.  After submitting a warranty request I was asked to provide pictures of the installation, stating that most problems are due to improper installation.  Well, the user manual is pretty easy to follow (you would have to be mentally challenged to make a mistake) regarding the proper installation.  It was already removed, anyway and there was no previous notice of this requirement for warranty.  So, I fully expect that they will not honor the warranty. My advice is "Save your money and time, buy something else".

productreview.author: Fred
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2018
productreview.review: Placed order, received system within week (even though it was out of stock, they brought it in). Easy to install, instructions are very clear.  It has an one year guarantee warranty.  With this warranty we can see if it really works.  We have added this is our other water system for descaling the water. Easy to fill out warranty card on line at website.  Nick from iSpring responded within hours confirming our warranty was valid and if any problems contact them immediately.  So far very happy with company.

productreview.author: C. Liew
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
productreview.review: I have been cleaning water spots on my sinks and taps for almost twenty years in CA because I did not know that this product exists!! Just over three weeks ago while visiting family up north, I commented on how spotless their sinks and hardware are,  this product became conversation. They had used a salt softener before but felt it was wasteful, due to flushing, etc. and after much research came to use the Eddy 2000. Almost immediately, I wanted to order that, but since it wasn't available, I opted for this brand. The concept is similar, and I have to say, this one is about $50 cheaper. So almost two weeks in, I have to write this review so this company stays in business and I can buy more when I get another house!!! I love it so much, it does what it says. Now my sinks are spotless without obsessive wiping and cleaning. I like it also that it does not filter out all the necessary elements that is in water as I do not want distilled water.  It is super easy to install, once you figure out the flow of your water. Note: I have copper pipes but be careful if you have old and/lead pipes, this is not for you.

productreview.author: JohnAN
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2019
productreview.review: Install was fairly  easy. Had it for 3 months still have not seen any improvement  on my water condition. Still have spots on dishes, shower head, sink faucet etc. Have to use CLR and Lime away to remove spots in shower and sinks. Vinegar in the dishwasher for the dishes. Now I have purchased a regular water softner to install for the water .conditioning

productreview.author: RickioLoto14
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018
productreview.review: Installed just before out cold and to tankless water heater on 3/4 CPVC.  Extremely hard water.  Calcium previously coated heater elements quickly and hard solid.  Checking elements after two weeks I see lots of calcium buildup but it seems softer, easier to scrape off.  At first evaluation, device makes very little impact.  Somewhere I read that device does better over time (although that does not make sense to me).  I'll continue to monitor and will update this post if needed.

productreview.author: T. Shepard
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
productreview.review: I purposely waited a few months before reviewing this item as I wanted to be sure it's doing what it says; and frankly that's not an easy question to answer.  Install is fairly straight forward.  Just follow the instructions and wrap the wires in the direction of water flow as described.  Plug it in and then....what?  Unless you can get inside your boiler there's no way of knowing for sure the deposits are being released into the water stream.  You would have to wait 5-10 or more years to see if you get more life out of your water tank.  Here in CO we have hard water w/ lots of minerals; my last water heater lasted about 7 years so I still have several years to go to see if this product extends the life of the new boiler. Barring testing water prior to installation and after (which I did not do), how can one tell if this thing is working?  First, the science is there.  I researched quite a bit before purchasing and multiple sources indicate this product does descale minerals from pipes and water tank.  Second, it's hard to be sure but when standing in the shower it does seem the water feels a bit softer on skin.  Rubbing fingers together under a flow of water seems slicker and smoother than prior to installation.  The problem is this could be a psychological effect of "wanting it to work"...hard to be certain.  Finally, and most notably for me is how my skin has reacted over time.  CO winter air is beyond dry.  The years I've lived here I need humidifiers constantly running, bottles of lotion used and still would be itchy most of the day.  This winter however there is a noticeable improvement.  My skin is not nearly as dry, I am not using lotion like I was and I do not itch anymore.  For me this is the true indicator that the product is working.  I'm not going to call it 'soft water', but it has the same effect as soft water which is all that matters to me.  For the price this was a good solution and totally worth it.

productreview.author: John Barrow-Native South Texan
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2019
productreview.review: I don't fully understand how this unit accomplishes the separation of calcium and magnesium to minimize and reduce scaling, buts its a great salt-free alternative at a tremendous cost savings if it works as represented. The company offers a very generous warranty for the product and their reviews are exceptional. In my instance, this is one part of a three part system, that has already enabled cleaner and clearer water that my family now has no hesitation drinking. ISpring states that reduction of scaling will become noticeable over a reasonable time duration. I am optimistic that it will and have awarded the stars in advance based somewhat upon their reputation and reported customer service. I will supplement this review if issues occur that change my rating. Edit: IMPORTANT: The instructions that come with the unit have a one page diagram of how to install it. The diagram shows a water flow direction with how to install the wires around a water pipe. In the same manual it states in Placement question one, page 5, "It does not matter" which way the water is flowing. In reviewing comments on this site, I see some folks have crossed wires to comport with the installation diagram. THIS was confusing to me and I installed my unit without crossing leads even though my water flow came from the right instead of left as diagrammed--based on the answer to Placement question one, "that it makes no difference which way the water flows. Today I talked to a customer a service representative who confirmed that water direction doesn't matter, but instructed me that if the water flows from right to left with the unit facing me (opposite as shown in the diagram, which I imagine at least half do, the remedy is to reverse the installation of the leads-- by reversing the direction of the leads. Instead of installing the downstream red wire starting under the pipe; install it going over. Install the upstream blue lead going under the pipe instead of going over. Customer service was cordial from ISpring, but I hope they will include a simple caveat on their installation page informing the above fix. Otherwise, the answer the first placement question on page 5 of their brochure guide should be that it does, or might, matter. I have no opinion as to what crossing the electromagnetic leads will or won't do.

productreview.author: Fred Bauer
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2019
productreview.review: Update: And we did. Unit did reduces scale buildup on fixtures, did not remove existing scale, and then the moving light stopped working (moving), just remained constant on. I contacted the company. They said no problem, if light is on, but not moving, it is still working, and refused to replace it? I ask, then wh was it moving in the first place? Got no answer. So, can't really tell if indeed it is functioning without more months of testing. No thanks. Avoid this one. Looks well made, installed easily, fired right up. instruction pretty good. However, for clean installation you need 8-12 cable ties (there were three in the box). And the "yellow" wire on mine was blue?? Will update in 30 days. Update: After two months does seem to slow down deposits a bit, but does nothing to remove old ones.

productreview.author: B
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
productreview.review: Do not waste your money on this product.  I did not have very hard water, but this did absolutely nothing to the overall water quality.  Hard water build up continued on all fixtures (and I might even say was worse post install).  After just over a year the unit failed as well.  If you want better water quality do not waste your money on these gadgets.  Invest in a good water softener and filter system.

productreview.author: Peter Spiller
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2018
productreview.review: Nick from iSpring asked for a review. Installed one day ago so cannot comment whether works. Pro: Excellent feel, fit and finish good. Easy to install. Clear directions but do not mention only effective (according to video) within 50 feet. Or whether effective after water exits hot water heater. Con: Sequenced flashing lights make on wonder if encouraging a placebo effect, ie, “Hey, amazing display, must be doing something.” No way immediately tell if effective, TDS readings do not change. Three star rating simply means we do not know. In six months we’ll be able to judge if less calcium scale forming.

productreview.author: Kiwi RKC
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
productreview.review: We live in a 120m2 apartment in Italy and since completely remodeling it in 2015 (all new plumbing, electrics, the whole works) I have had to descale the faucet filters and shower heads every two weeks. Our plumber installed a magnetic descaler at the inlet to the hot water storage cylinder 18 months ago but this made little difference. This year we decided it was time to find an effective solution and were thinking of a conventional, high-maintenance whole-house system but, due to the limited space available where the supply enters our apartment, knew it would be a challenge. A search on Amazon's Italian site turned up the "usual suspects", but I noticed several systems from iSpring so went to their website for more info in english and there discovered the ED2000. This seemed to meet our particular needs but it isn't offered on Amazon Italy so I ordered a unit via Amazon.com, knowing the power supply is 110V but no problem as I have had a 240V-110V step-down transformer for many years. The unit arrived in 3 days (well done Amazon logistics!!), well packed, clearly a quality product from a serious company and was installed the next day. As you can see from the 2nd & 3rd pics, space is extremely tight but with considerable patience I was able to get both cables wound - even if the red isn't perfectly tight. It is now 12 days since the system commenced operation and we have both noticed better hot water pressure with no drop-off over a few days as the faucet filters load up. The shower heads are also much better, with no calcium build-up evident over at all - previously they were starting to block after a week. The ED2000 is the optimum solution for the water composition we have in central-west Italy (1 hour from Rome on the Tyrrhenian Sea). We expect to see continued improvement over time and look forward to many years of decent, soft water. Customer support from iSpring has been outstanding, one of the best I have experienced over many years and countless purchases through Amazon.

productreview.author: Mia
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2018
productreview.review: Installed the device just few days ago and already feel and taste the difference of our water. The main reason we getting the product is to prevent hair lost cause by the hard water in Midwest region. The installation was extremely easy. I just followed the instruction booklet provided in the box and complete the installation in less than 15 min. the only main thing that people has to be aware of is to make sure the water flow direction and wire thread direction are the same as the instruction shown. I'm look forward to have the device for long period term, and clear the scale build up in the water pipe.

productreview.author: Daniel & Janet
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
productreview.review: In TN we have hard water.  We had hard water stains all over the shower door glass, the inside of the dishwasher, and the glassware never seemed to be clean.  Additionally, the calcium/ calcite was not being dissolved by cleaning with CLR. The faucets actually grew teeth out of the spout, and all this from a County wide water service, not a well.  Looked into a "water softener" at big box home stores and researched the issue.  Lots of money and time to add salt, sand etc.  Plus, we bought the house with a water softener on it and our PSI at shower head was weak. Removed it and now good flow. So did not want to go that route again. Found this product. Installed it, and now no more hard water stains. A few things.  Follow the instructions and wrap one wire the one way and the other the revers. Then, duct tape them to the pipe.  I then put foam insulation around the whole pipe.  Try and wrap the pipe just as it come into your home.  We were both surprised at this product and have recommended it to friends and co-workers.  Do not know that it makes our skin/ hair softer, makes us sleep better, or is the cure for the heartbreak of Psoriasis, but we no longer have the water spots and the glasses are cleaner.  Enough said.

productreview.author: rebesty
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
productreview.review: I’m amazed! We moved into a house in a well with very hard water. There was limescale and calcium in every fixture and stuck to granite countertops that had to be chiseled off. Water tasted very much like iron making it completely unpalatable. Our brewed coffee even tasted bad. My hair was dry, frizzy and dull. We got an estimate for a water treatment system including a filter and salt softener for $3500. I started looking into alternatives. I became interested in the descalers for the softening effects on my dishes, laundry, skin and hair, but also for the possibility of reducing the damaging effects of for the last 4 decades of hard untreated water in the old house pipes. Hubby installed it 2 days ago near the well with the box recommended by another reviewer for outdoor install. We Immediately noticed change in the smell and taste. I showered and washed my hair and noticed the soap lathers better. Most impressively, my hair is smooth, soft and shiny! I’m very happy with this product and is low price point.

productreview.author: shadetree
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
productreview.review: We installed our unit a month ago and have been pleasantly surprised at its effectiveness. I was a skeptic since I have been involved in water treatment for scotch marine boiler operations most of my life and thought a regular water softener was the only solution. I'm sure your results will vary, but it is working well on our well water. It is working well to keep our dishwasher and dishes from getting that mineral haze on everything. We don't have to use the expensive detergents any longer. Iron discoloration in the toilet bowls has been reduced considerably also.

productreview.author: Jordie
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
productreview.review: Let me first say that I prepared for this purchase by researching the recommendations the manufacturer had mad before buying it. I knew I needed water within a certain hardness range, <3 ppm iron, and that it would only be good for 50 ft of pipe after the wrap. I tested my water and it was all good so I went ahead and bought it. Luckily, I have two water inlets to my house because one end is an addition. This allowed me to easily install the unit while observing the 50ft pipe rule. I have a total of maybe 30 ft of pipe after the install, with the hot water heater being within 10 feet. Within the first week I noticed that the water felt different and my soap was getting my hands cleaner. I used to wash my hands and have a slick feeling like my hands were oily still (I have oily skin/hands) but I noticed that when I would wash my hands they were very "sticky". Not really like I have syrup on my fingers, but if I tried to slide my fingers against each other after washing and drying them, they'd feel more like I washed my hands with something that took off all the oils. This is very anecdotal and not really something you can say is a definitive thing that a person might think is just in my head, so now for the hard evidence. I have a mirror in the shower that I use for shaving. I have to scrub it with gritty toothpaste every time I use it to clean off the deposits. It takes about a week for it to build up to the point that I clean it. Well I installed this after I didn't shave for about 6 weeks and decided to touch up a little after it had been installed for a month. I cleaned off the mirror with toothpaste and got to work. I decided that maybe this could be my test and started checking it weekly to see how it was going. So far the only thing that sticks to the mirror looks like soap scum (I have my bar on a caddy that has a hook below it where the mirror hangs) and I can just wet it and wipe it off. Maybe it's minerals but they aren't sticking to the point that they require anything to remove. Just my hand and water. This is all I wanted from this thing. Reduce the deposits that were difficult to clean/remove and hopefully extend the life of my hot water heater element. I had a brand new hot water tank when we moved into this house, and after 8 months the element was toast and the bottom of the tank was full of deposits that I had a hard time removing (read chisel, vinegar, and many flushes). I have had this installed for about 3 months so it's not been near long enough to tell how it works for the longevity of the hot water heater, but it's worth it for the cleaning hassles with the fixtures. My wife loves it. All in all I'd recommend it 100% if your water meets the requirements or can be conditioned to meet them. Otherwise, I have no idea, but I doubt it'll work outside what the manufacturer says it will. I will be buying another one to install on the other water inlet to the house, which is the one that supplies the kitchen.

productreview.author: Texas Rose
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
productreview.review: I live in a rocky area with extremely hard water.  Our very expensive water softener contained some sort of gel that ruined our septic system, as we are not on city water, and it did not last 5 years.  We unhooked this water softener and for 3 months have been living with no water softener at all.  I told my husband that we had to do something, as our shower heads had to be replaced and my skin and hair were getting brittle and lackluster. We found the iSpring ED2000 on Amazon and decided to try it in lieu of the expensive (over $4,000) softener we had previously.  We are delighted to say IT WORKS!  I am loving my shower again and my hair is back to soft, shiny manageability!  We can’t believe the savings not just from initial purchase, but no salt to buy, and no maintenance!  I honestly find it works just as well, if not better than a traditional water softener.  I know this one won’t hurt our septic system, and soap and detergents lather better so I can use less.  My laundry is actually cleaner now than before.  This product is well worth the price — I will never own a conventional water softener again — wish I had known about this product 6 water softeners ago.  What a racket!  Thank you iSpring for a superb product at a great price!

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2018
productreview.review: I think it works. Our Culligan system died and they don't make replacement parts so thought we'd try this. I'll never buy another Culligan product because they expect you to buy new systems rather than replacement parts. Too much $$$$ Our water tastes better now and the old calcium deposits have not returned since installing this device. Easy to install.

products.title: Travel Cable Organizer Electronics organzier Travel Cable Cases Electronic Organizer Bag for Hard Drives, Cables, Charger, USB, SD Cardr (2layer Black)

productreview.author: Lawrence Anastasi
productreview.review: In this little bag I have a GPS, window mount, charging cable, Olympus camera with case, extra batteries and charger, a hero camera with attachments , battery charger,  window mount, extra cables , batteries, and connectors. It holds everything secure and is a strong little bag. No more searching through my hand luggage,  I put an address label on the inside just in case I misplace it while travelling. Worth more than what I paid.

productreview.author: Angelo
productreview.reviewTitle: Keeps all my tech cable very organized!
productreview.review: This case surely can hold all of my tech needs from numerous USB cables, DSLR charger, spare batteries, SD Card case, etc. My cables used to be everywhere so I decided to get this Travel Cable Organizer in colour blue as shown in my pic. It's very handy and keeps all my accessories solely organized and hassle free. It has 2 compartments but I wouldn't recommend putting anything heavy inside as I find the quality of the thread is not as sturdy. Over all 10/10 would recommend this bag if you wanna keep your tech needs to be organized and aesthetically pleasing!

productreview.author: Am C
productreview.review: I like organization but I find there are charging cables and wires al over the house and they are a tangled mess. I have organized and labeled all the cords now and put them in the case. Not only good for traveling but just  around the house.

productreview.author: Lindsay Lee
productreview.reviewTitle: Great for all my camera stuff
productreview.review: Great bag for all my camera accessories. This bag was perfect for all my little camera accessories / cables / batteries and cards. Zipper wasn't flimsy like my previous bag.

productreview.author: Amazon Customer
productreview.review: Bought this for all my cables and small computer accessories, works great! Lots of pockets n zippers. Keeps everything well organized.

productreview.author: Chris
productreview.review: Not as sturdy as they appear, kind of disappointed, but at least I have them now. I needed them for a trip and they worked, but the zippers are kinda weak

productreview.author: Rich
productreview.review: Good product well contructed and sturdy

productreview.author: JPG
productreview.review: Larger than I was expecting

productreview.author: alex burris
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
productreview.review: The zippers are cheap, they will be probably be the first thing to break on this bag. But the organization this bag offers is great, it surprised me with how much I was able to put in it with it still looking neat. For the price it is worth it. I would expect the next better version that would have good zippers would be made by fossil, samsonite or something similar and around $30-50. The price for the product is good.

productreview.author: Julia
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020
productreview.review: I love all the different compartments. It really has made traveling so much easier because all my cords and other computer items can fit so nicely in this organizer. I can’t really get much use from the bigger compartment due to the velcro being sewn on so cheaply. It’s really flimsy and I cannot really create sturdy compartments.

productreview.author: Julia Schmidt
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
productreview.review: This case is awesome, keeps all of the chargers together, Really like it.

productreview.author: Alyssa
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
productreview.review: I haven’t traveled with it yet but I expect that to be easy. Everything fits nicely in it. All of my cords and chargers are neatly organized and separated. It great for every day storage.

productreview.author: Nestor Giovanni Luglio
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
productreview.review: Perfect

products.title: SOONAN 128 in 1 Precision Screwdriver Set Professional Electronics Repair Tool Kit Magnetic Drive Kit with Portable Bag for Repair Cellphone, MacBook, Computer, Tablet, iPad, Xbox, Game Console

productreview.author: Danny
productreview.review: I have bought several mini screwdriver set from the internet and by far this one is the best. The handle is made of aluminum alloy with an anti-slip coating which is great compared to the steel plactic handles I bought before.  Those handles can be slippery at times especially when my hand was sweating.  The turncap design is good to have so instead of turning with your wrist you may turn with your fingers as long as you have the turncap fasten with your palm.  That makes your work more efficient when you have many screws to deal with. Included in the set are 48 magnetic S2 tool steel bits which are the jewels of the set.  The bit heads are very tuff and do not chip or strip when you are trying to unscrew a rusted or jammed screws. The bit heads from my other sets had chipped and striped which is very frustrating.  The bits are also magnetic which is great because it makes it so much easier to handle the small screws instead of my fat fingers.  And because the bits are magnetic they seldom fall out of the handle or sleeves.

productreview.author: Santah
productreview.review: Had to open laptop to upgrade hard drive and replace screen on cell phone. This set had all I needed to get the job done. I was tired to look around d the house/garage to try to find the right screwdriver for every diferent screw so decided to get a set which would cover it all. This set did it for me. Strong enough for what I needed - not just for the laptop but surprisingly for the cell phone as well. Buying all the scredriwer separately would cost much more and this way I have all of them together whenever I need them.

productreview.author: Yaghma
productreview.review: < Unboxing > Unboxing was pretty straightforward. The product wasn't damaged and was packaged nicely. < Build Quality > The build on this is amazing. It's all metal. It has a pretty good heft to it. I am kinda worried about scratches on the metal casing though. It seems pretty easy to scuff if it comes in contact with other metal stuff. Also, the closing mechanism is plastic so it seems it might break easily. Mine hasn't showed any problems but it's something to keep in mind. < Usage > The tips are magnetic which is a godsend when building PC's. The number of bits in this set is amazing. You can find just about anything. The tips seem pretty resistant to stripping so that's a plus. < Verdict > If you're in the market for a screwdriver set on the cheap with great set of bits and build quality, this is THE ONE to get. Although it doesn't include accessories like squeegies and pry tools for smartphone repairs, it is still great for everything else. Get it!

productreview.author: David Hicks
productreview.reviewTitle: Quality screwdriver set with all the oddball mini bits (pentalobe, triwing)
productreview.review: I needed a few mini screwdrivers for some repair work including Apple's pentalobe (for MacBook Pro) and a Triwing for a Nintendo switch. Having purchased these types of drivers before and been unsatisfied with poor quality that stripped out or were badly machined I dug around an found this kit which looked nice and had good reviews for quality. I was pleased when it arrived and found all these things to be true. It's a compact case with almost every conceivable bit you could need for electronics repair. The bits themselves are high quality, well machined, accurate and seem very durable. The driver itself is quite small and thin so not the most ergonomic handle but you're not going to be reefing on the torque with tiny fasteners so it's suitable to task. The case is a nice bonus. It's nice and compact and the bits are held in magnetically so easy to remove and store (unlike some blow-moulded cases which you have to struggle with). The driver itself snaps in rather than magnetic. A bonus is the bits have a small magnetic charge which helps hold small screws in place while working. Everything slides into the aluminum sleeve (with plastic endcap) which has a spring loaded 'button' to pop it open. Overall very impressed at getting an entire quality set in a nice case for the price of a few individual screwdrivers. Perfect for home repair jobs.

productreview.author: Jack
productreview.review: this made my life so much easier when it comes to dealing with electronics part replacement. I recently had to open my MacBook Pro, the problem with MacBook pro screws is that they are very different than usual ones. This kit had exactly what I needed... a few days later I had to replace the battery in my wrist watch, and once again it came very handy. so far my experience has been really good with it. overall it's sturdy and is made of good material. I recommend it.

productreview.author: SWINCAN
productreview.review: As far as off brand items we've purchased on Amazon goes, this one has to be one of the most surprising yet. For the price, we were just expecting a neat solution to our messy shoe box full of screwdriver odds and ends. We didn't expect it to be so well made and solid. The packaging is non descript, and once you pull out the case you realize this is a keeper - we've happily tossed all our other small bits and this sits neatly in our tool drawer. It's got every small head you could need, and it's cleverly designed so the size in its entirety is no more than 1.5 of my hand size. You push in on the drawer side and the try clicks out, reveling 24 bits on both sides and the driver in the middle. Everything is magnetized so you don't have to worry about everything falling out or anything like that. As mentioned, it feels so solid to the touch and looks like something that will last us a long time.

productreview.author: Moe
productreview.reviewTitle: Great design, good quality, great value
productreview.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Just received the kit, quick and as promised. Can't make a comment on durability now, but it seems pretty sturdy and solid. The material quality is good and feels nice in the hand. Great value for the price.

productreview.author: Dark-Knight23
productreview.reviewTitle: Everything is magnetic, bits hold screws and bits are held in the holder magnetically.
productreview.review: What I liked about this product is the amount of bits available. I work on many electronics particularly on cellphone repairs and I was looking for a set that has a good bit for new tri wing screws on the iPhone 7 and up. This set had the Y 0.6 bit and worked perfectly without stripping the screw. Compact case that is a push lock close.

productreview.author: Hari Govind
productreview.review: I was very impressed with the build quality and design of this screwdriver set. The magnetic box holds the screw heads nicely in place, but is still easy to remove needed screw head. The case has a sweet click in lock, which ensures the screwdriver and the head holder/plate stays inside the cover even if flipped upside down. One thing i really liked about the screw heads are that they don't easily strip the screw heads thread. I used it on my laptop screws and noticed that the the damage was minimal when i used the wrong screw head. That being said, the screw heads tend to easily wear out, but i prefer that over a damaged screw as those are harder to replace if the head is destroyed, especially in devices with small screw heads like a laptop.

productreview.author: CDT
productreview.reviewTitle: Great set of bits for electronics repair in a compact case.
productreview.review: The set of bits is great and is well organized and labelled in a nice compact case. The durability is questionable, not great for screws that require some torque to break. Also the magnets that keeps the bit in fell out the second time I used it. Easily fixed with some crazy glue. But the security/proprietary bit selection is fantastic and should get you into any device that would prefer you not open it. My only complaint is the type of steel the bits are made of is brittle, and the magnet falling out after only my second laptop repair proves there is room for improvement in QC.  This type of steal is not THAT BAD, and I have seen it used in tools that were intended for more heavy duty application (including some Gerber Multi Tools, where every bit broke, including the blade). So for the intended use case, I think it's acceptable material, and often I'd rather have a the bit damaged than the screw stripped, so it's a give and take. 5 stars for value for money though.

productreview.author: Philippe B.
productreview.reviewTitle: Ok, so you get what you pay for...
productreview.review: The kit is ok for the price. Tons of bits and accessories. They honestly look flimsy but i plan to make 'light' usage of it. Hexagonal drivers are not deep enough to accomodate raspberry pi hexagonal posts that have a male end. This is why i bought this kit in the first place so, bummer. I would have expected the driver to act as a ratchet (click-click-click), unfortunatly it is fully 'manual'. Bummer #2.
