productreview.author: J.Dixon
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 12, 2013
productreview.review: We used to use our phones as GPS units, as we both have smart phones with inbuilt GPS devices. They work quite well, and we had few problems with using them in this way - however the accuracy was not always particularly good, especially when in a city or driving on tree-lined roads. This also made our hobby difficult, as we are avid geocachers. A lot of the time, this requires a good GPS signal, even under tree cover. With our phones consistently getting lost under tree-cover, this made finding the caches much more difficult. When we decided to start placing our own caches, having a VERY accurate device was a must - but I didn't want to splash out on a hand-held GPS device that would be little to no use in the car. This bluetooth GPS has completely revolutionised our geocaching and driving! Not only does it increase the battery life on our phones by about 4x (as the GPS on phones absorb battery!) but when it's on and connected, it generally can locate us to less than a meter, even under tree cover, and in built-up areas! If you are trying to connect to anything which isn't an iPhone (we use our Android phones) - there is a little switch on the side which enables you to set it into the non-Apple mode. I recommend the 'Bluetooth GPS' app on the Play Store - but you will have to set the "Use Insecure Connection" to on. Once this is done, click connect and you'll be running! The unit also comes with a plethora of useful additions, including a rubber dashboard mount, an elasticated wrist strap, a USB charger and a very sturdy car charger. Very highly recommended.

productreview.author: C. Hawkes
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 1, 2014
productreview.review: Having purchased a non 4G WiFi only iPad, and then trying to use a Naviotronics navigation app, I quickly realised that the non-4G models don't have a GPS receiver. What to do? This Dual external received was the answer. It connects to the iPad via bluetooth, and once paired the program run like a dream. Easy set-up, and easy to use. I keep the receiver inside the cabin of my boat, where it has no trouble pickling up satellites, and the iPad happily sits in the cockpit telling me where I am. Perfect. I have to praise the seller too. My first unit inexplicably failed after 11 months of use - it was replaced the next day without any problems. Thank you, Dual, too, for the concerns you voiced and the help you offered.

productreview.author: Dr. G. S. Pyne
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 7, 2013
productreview.review: My wifi-only iPad Mini does not include GPS, which is standard on the 3G version. Dual’s XGPS150A remedies this shortcoming, albeit at a price. (I paid about £69). Once you have paid though it’s pretty much all good news. The device is sensitive and pairs easily with my iPad. Even indoors (tested upstairs) it quickly acquires a full set of satellites. Dual’s free app (available from iTunes store) works fine, showing the satellite signal strength along with position, position confidence, altitude, speed and battery condition. The battery lasts for about 8 hours and takes about 3 hours to recharge via the USB connector provided. This GPS receiver works with all the maps I have tested it with but beware that some (such as Google maps) need to stream data via internet. A wifi-only iPad cannot do this. However – usually for more money! - there are plenty of downloadable maps available (eg TomTom and nautical charts), which mostly come with an app to provide other navigational information. My XGPS150A came with a 12V car charger, non-slip rubber dashboard holder and some carrying straps. It is well-made and does what I wanted.

productreview.author: Paul GEE
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 18, 2013
productreview.review: Just to say that this great little Bluetooth remote GPS antenna works perfectly with my 16Gb iPad Mini (with WiFi and 3G chip) in an aviation environment using SkyDemon.  Flew from EBCI to LFAT and back yesterday in a C172 after having tested the setup locally last week.  Total confidence, simple setup and works 110%.  It is a neat, modern-looking unit; the "sticky pad" accessory works great on the top of the aircraft glare shield and never moves at all.  Connection to iPad was utterly simple and quick.  If there is anything that the design engineers could look at again, I think it would have to be the armband/straps which do not appear to be to the same high design/manufacturing standards as the rest of the kit - more of an afterthought given to the apprentice to bash out!  All in all, I am delighted with the unit, and with the Amazon "system".  PG

productreview.author: hawkman
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 6, 2015
productreview.review: A useful device that works very well indeed but I am thankful for a previous review by G.Samara who highlighted a glitch when setting up on iOS devices.  Followed that advice and all worked well, without that I would have been scratching my head for a good while. I am using this with an ipod touch 4th gen and UK maps which is excellent for hiking on the hills.

productreview.author: Mr R
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 7, 2013
productreview.review: A nicely compact gizmo. Works brilliantly with iPad navigation apps. I went through a short period when I thought is was malfunctioning. I have found it necessary to disconnect Bluetooth, COMPLETELY power-off the iPad, power-on and start again; but having got used to this routine, it appears to be working excellently. Without this 'niggle', definitely 5 star. The DUAL GPS Status Tool is a very useful app. to go with it.

productreview.author: John Varney
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 21, 2013
productreview.review: I was debating wether to buy a GPS unit or not but there aren't many out there for cycling. With the brilliant map app I have on my ipad and the investment in digital maps for it I went for this instead. I am not disappointed. It was easy to set up and I have used it for walking and cycling and found it to interact with my maps perfectly. It is very accurate in its abbility to get a signal even under trees. The unit holds enough charge for a full days exploring and it doesnt sap the battery on the ipad either All I want now is to justify buying a mini ipad, that would be better for when I'm out on the bike.

productreview.author: B D Kiely
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 10, 2015
productreview.review: Bought to work with an iPad whilst hiking this unit performed brilliantly. Works really well with good battery life. Universal Bluetooth GPS Receiver (Wirelessly Add GPS To Your Devices)

productreview.author: Les Coe
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 5, 2016
productreview.review: This little device compliments my iPad, allowing trails to be recorded, footpaths to be negotiated with great confidence. A boon for anyone not so confident in their map reading skills. Used in conjunction with the OS Maps app.

productreview.author: gizmo
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 3, 2014
productreview.review: What more can I say? I took it out of the box and paired it with both my iPad and iPhone in minutes. Downloaded the recommended app to both devices and it works great. I now have gps on my iPad, (my priority), and it should also help save the battery on my iPhone. If I leave Apple, (never say never), I can use it on any other device. Well chuffed.

productreview.review: I bought these filters to replace the ones in my Allure hoodfan SPECIFICALLY because they are listed as "dishwasher safe". They fit great, looked awesome, shiny and new, until I put them in the dishwasher for the first time. Now they are discoloured and look worse than the old, grease-filled ones. I would have cleaned them another way if I had known they would tarnish so badly in the dishwasher. So, don't believe the description like I did, and make sure to clean them with a degreaser spray and not in the dishwasher!

productreview.author: admin
productreview.reviewTitle: Amazing kit to introduce the next generation to electronics
productreview.review: I had one of these kits in the early 90s as a kid and absolutely loved it. It also led me into a pretty decent career path where I work for a good company with good pay. I got this set for my 3 and 5yr old nieces and in about a week they have managed to put together about 8 of the circuits, including the AM radio transmitter. This kit has taught the 5 year old how to wire things according to the diagrams and always go over all the connections a 2nd time before she connects the battery, and so far everything has worked first time for them. Great way to help start the kiddos early and make sure we have a next generation of electronics engineers to keep the world going.

As a stepping stone for future bomb disposal experts, its absolutely what id expect. If you have boys, they will love it.

productreview.author: Kindle Customer
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 2, 2019
productreview.review: Fortunately I was present when the youngster who received it as a Christmas present attempted to make the first project (a simple LED light & switch).  It did not work.  A quick check with a meter revealed that the battery had been connected to the wrong terminals (polarity of battery reversed).  Easily compensated if you are experienced, but it confused the youngster that he could not follow the diagrams for any of the projects but always had to swap the connections to the battery terminals.  Very shoddy quality control!!!  I have a feeling that one of the electrolytic capacitors was also reversed - if not then it was very leaky which made the bistable circuits unreliable.

productreview.author: Dave Rawson
productreview.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 1, 2019
productreview.review: Not happy at all with this kit. A Christmas present for my son which very quickly proved to be substandard. First I noticed that the variable resistor was connected to the spring connectors back to front and the pointer was incorrectly fitted. Then I found that the transformer didn't work. A note in the box said to contact the manufacturer, not the retailer, in the event of any defects. I sent them an email asking what I should do as I'm in the UK and they're in the USA but have not even received a response.

He spent hours doing the projects and his Dad was impressed too!!!  Would highly recommend for those boys and indeed girls who have an inquisitive brain and want to know how things work.  Marvelous !!!

productreview.author: Baveeta
productreview.review: For some reason the new Macbook Air 2020 screens are very hard to clean compared to the older macbooks. I got a fingerprint on my screen and was unable to clean it. When I tried other methods of cleaning it the fingerprint just got worse and spread. I tried to take it to the Apple store but they could not figure out how to clean the screen and made it worse. I thought I would buy this cloth since it was close to 5$. I bought two since after reading reviews I wanted to use one cloth as my dry and one as a wet cloth. I turned off my laptop and let it sit for an hour. After I used the dry cloth to wipe my laptop. Sprayed water on the 2nd cloth and wiped my laptop and then used the dry cloth again. The fingerprint along with the rest of the smudges were gone. I really like it and think it is worth the money.

productreview.reviewTitle: Eco friendly, chemical free, great results!
productreview.review: I am one of those crazy people that loves to clean my house and has all of the fancy cleaning gadgets to do it with. If you're like me, this cloth is a MUST HAVE. It cleans my TVs easily and perfectly. I just glide the cloth over the screen, and it takes EVERYTHING OFF (even puppy nose marks, husband finger prints, and sneeze spots!) The best part is that it does this with NO water! This cloth, dry, leaves my TV screens impeccable. This cloth actually grabs and holds all of the dust that it picks up - no pushing dirt around. And because it's dry, no risk of damaging my electronics. This cloth works great for cell phones, lap top and tablet screens as well. Completely streak free finish. I love being able to clean my screens without chemicals. I also love that I pop this cloth in the wash, hang it up to dry, and it's ready go go again. Chemical free, eco friendly, great results. I will be purchasing more  of these cloths to put into stockings for my extended family at Christmas. Every home needs one! I'm happy with this purchase, I feel it was $5 well spent. This cloth will last years!
